paras.en: Every year in the spring, the fifth graders of Beecher Prep go away for three days and two nights to a place called the Broarwood Nature Reserve in Pennsylvania. It's a four-hour bus drive away. The kids sleep in cabins with bunk beds. There are campfires and s'mores and long walks through the woods. The teachers have been prepping us about this all year long, so all the kids in the grade are excited about it— except for me. And it's not even that I'm not excited, because I kind of am—it's just I've never slept away from home before and I'm kind of nervous.
paras.cn: 每年春天，比彻预备学校的五年级学生都会去一个叫宾夕法尼亚州布罗伍德自然保护区的地方待上三天两夜。那里有四个小时的巴士车程。孩子们睡在有双层床的小木屋里。有篝火、巧克力棉花糖夹心饼干和在树林里的长途散步。老师们一整年来都在为我们这件事做准备，所以年级里所有的孩子都对此很兴奋——除了我。而且也不是说我不兴奋，因为我有点兴奋——只是我以前从没在外面过夜，我有点紧张。

vocab.ex: We went hiking in the nearby nature reserve to see wildlife.
The two brothers shared a room with a bunk bed.

vocab.mean: 巧克力棉花糖夹心饼干
vocab.ex: Making s'mores over the campfire is a classic summer tradition.
The coach was prepping the team for the championship game.
She always feels nervous before an important exam.

gram.name: It's not that... it's just... 结构
gram.pattern: It's not that [reason A], it's just that [reason B].
gram.function: 用于澄清或修正一个潜在的误解。叙述者首先否定了一个简单的解释（不是不兴奋），然后给出了一个更复杂、更精确的原因（是兴奋，但因为从未在外过夜而更紧张）。这是一种表达复杂、矛盾情感的有效结构。

example.en: It's not that I don't want to go; it's just that I'm really tired.
example.cn: 不是我不想去，只是我真的太累了。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的澄清和解释的说法。

paras.en: Most kids have had sleepovers by the time they're my age. A lot of kids have gone to sleepaway camps, or stayed with their grandparents or whatever. Not me. Not unless you include hospital stays, but even then Mom or Dad always stayed with me overnight. But I never slept over Tata and Poppa's house, or Aunt Kate and Uncle Po's house. When I was really little, that was mainly because there were too many medical issues, like my trache tube needing to be cleared every hour, or reinserting my feeding tube if it got detached. But when I got bigger, I just never felt like sleeping anywhere else.
paras.cn: 大多数孩子到我这个年纪都已经有过在外过夜的经历了。很多孩子去过寄宿夏令营，或者在祖父母家住过什么的。我没有。除非你把住院也算上，但即便那样，爸爸或妈妈也总是陪我过夜。但我从未在塔塔和波帕家过夜，也从未在凯特姑姑和波叔叔家过夜。当我真的很小的时候，那主要是因为有太多的医疗问题，比如我的气管插管每小时都需要清理，或者如果我的喂食管脱落了需要重新插入。但当我长大后，我就是不想在别的地方睡觉。

vocab.ex: She's going to her first sleepover at her best friend's house this weekend.
He was nervous but excited to go to sleepaway camp for the first time.
We can watch a movie, play a game, or whatever.
The patient required a trache tube to help him breathe.
The nurse had to reinsert the IV needle.
After the surgery, he was fed through a feeding tube.
You can detach the keyboard from the tablet.

gram.name: 用于强调的句子片段
gram.pattern: A short, incomplete sentence.
gram.function: 使用一个非常简短的句子片段 'Not me.' 来与前文进行强烈的对比。这种手法比使用完整的句子（如 'That has not happened to me.'）更具冲击力，更直接地强调了主角经历的独特性和孤独感。

example.en: Everyone else went to the party. Not him.
example.cn: 其他所有人都去了派对。他没去。

gram.constraints: 是一种非正式但有效的文学技巧，用于创造强烈的节奏和对比。

paras.en: There was one time when I half slept over Christopher's house. We were about eight, and we were still best friends. Our family had gone for a visit to his house, and me and Christopher were having such a great time playing Legos Star Wars that I didn't want to leave when it was time to go. We were like, "Please, please, please can we have a sleepover?" So our parents said yes, and Mom and Dad and Via drove home. And me and Christopher stayed up till midnight playing, until Lisa, his mom, said: "Okay, guys, time to go to bed." Well, that's when I kind of panicked a bit. Lisa tried to help me go to sleep, but I just started crying that I wanted to go home. So at one a.m. Lisa called Mom and Dad, and Dad drove all the way back out to Bridgeport to pick me up. We didn't get home until three a.m. So my one and only sleepover, up until now, was pretty much of a disaster, which is why I'm a little nervous about the nature retreat.
paras.cn: 有一次，我算是在克里斯托弗家半过夜了。那时我们大概八岁，我们仍然是最好的朋友。我们家去他家做客，我和克里斯托弗玩乐高星球大战玩得太开心了，以至于到该走的时候我不想离开。我们当时就说：“求求你，求求你，求求你，我们能一起过夜吗？” 于是我们的父母同意了，妈妈、爸爸和维娅就开车回家了。我和克里斯托弗一直玩到半夜，直到他的妈妈丽莎说：“好了，孩子们，该上床睡觉了。” 嗯，就在那时我有点慌了。丽莎试着帮我入睡，但我就是开始哭着说我想回家。于是在凌晨一点，丽莎给爸爸妈妈打了电话，爸爸一路开车回到布里奇波特来接我。我们直到凌晨三点才到家。所以，到目前为止，我唯一的一次过夜经历，基本上是场灾难，这就是为什么我对这次自然静修有点紧张。

vocab.ex: The door was only half closed.
We stayed up all night talking.
He started to panic when he realized he was lost.
After realizing he forgot his wallet, he had to drive all the way back home.
This is my one and only chance to win.
The party was a complete disaster; everything went wrong.

gram.name: which is why... (表原因)
gram.pattern: ..., which is why + clause.
gram.function: 用于引出一个结果，并解释其原因，'which' 指代前面整个主句所描述的事件。'...was pretty much of a disaster, which is why I'm a little nervous...' 清晰地连接了过去的失败经历和现在的紧张情绪。

example.en: I missed my train this morning, which is why I was late for work.
example.cn: 我今天早上错过了火车，这就是我上班迟到的原因。

gram.constraints: 是一种连接因果关系的常见结构。

paras.en: On the other hand, I'm really excited.
paras.cn: 另一方面，我真的很兴奋。

vocab.ex: The job pays well, but on the other hand, the hours are very long.
The children were excited about opening their presents.

gram.name: 转折连词 (On the other hand)
gram.pattern: On the other hand, + contrasting clause.
gram.function: 用于引出一个与前文观点形成对比的、不同的方面。在详细阐述了紧张的原因之后，这个简短的句子用 'On the other hand' 引入了完全相反的情绪，深刻地揭示了主角内心的矛盾与挣扎。

example.en: Living in the city is exciting. On the other hand, it can be very expensive.
example.cn: 住在城市里很刺激。但另一方面，消费可能非常高。

gram.constraints: 通常用于对比一个话题的两个不同方面。

paras.en: I asked Mom to buy me a new rolling duffel bag because my old one had Star Wars stuff on it, and there was no way I was going to take that to the fifth-grade nature retreat. As much as I love Star Wars, I don't want that to be what I'm known for.
paras.cn: 我让妈妈给我买一个新的带轮子的行李袋，因为我旧的那个上面有星球大战的东西，我绝不可能带那个去五年级的自然静修。尽管我非常喜欢《星球大战》，但我不想因此而出名。

vocab.ex: For his trip, he packed everything into a large rolling duffel bag.
There's no way I'm going outside in this terrible storm.

vocab.mean: 自然静修（指去自然环境中的短期旅行）
vocab.ex: The school organized a nature retreat for the students in the mountains.
As much as I enjoy pizza, I can't eat it every day.
That restaurant is known for its excellent seafood.

gram.name: 使用 'as much as' 表示让步
gram.pattern: As much as + clause, + main clause.
gram.function: 用于引出一个让步状语从句，承认一个事实或观点，但主句表达了与此相反或更重要的观点，意为“尽管”。它强调了主角内心的冲突：对《星球大战》的热爱和他不想被其定义的愿望。

example.en: As much as he wanted to win, he knew it was more important to play fairly.
example.cn: 尽管他很想赢，但他知道公平竞争更重要。

gram.constraints: 是一种较为正式的让步表达方式。

paras.en: Everyone's known for something in middle school. Like Reid is known for really being into marine life and the oceans and things like that. And Amos is known for being a really good baseball player. And Charlotte is known for having been in a TV commercial when she was six. And Ximena's known for being really smart.
paras.cn: 在中学里，每个人都因某件事而出名。比如里德以非常痴迷海洋生物和海洋之类的事情而闻名。阿莫斯以是一名非常优秀的棒球运动员而闻名。夏洛特以六岁时上过电视广告而闻名。而西梅纳以非常聪明而闻名。

vocab.ex: That restaurant is known for its excellent seafood.
My brother is really into classic cars.
The documentary was about the diverse marine life of the coral reef.
She became an actress after appearing in a popular TV commercial.

gram.name: 排比与首语重复法
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase at the beginning of successive clauses.
gram.function: 通过在连续的句子开头重复 '...is known for...' 结构（一种首语重复法），作者建立了一种强烈的节奏感，并有力地列举了一系列例子来支撑“每个人都因某件事而出名”这一核心观点。

example.en: He is remembered for his kindness. He is remembered for his generosity. He is remembered for his courage.
example.cn: 人们因他的善良而记住他。人们因他的慷慨而记住他。人们因他的勇气而记住他。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和列举。

paras.en: My point is that in middle school you kind of get known for what you're into, and you have to be careful about stuff like that. Like Max G and Max W will never live down their Dungeons & Dragons obsession.
paras.cn: 我的观点是，在中学里，你有点会因为你痴迷的东西而出名，你得对那样的事情小心。比如麦克斯G和麦克斯W将永远无法摆脱他们对《龙与地下城》痴迷的标签。

vocab.ex: We can argue all day, but my point is that we need to make a decision now.
He's starting to get known for his unique style of painting.

vocab.mean: （因做过某件尴尬或愚蠢的事而）不再被人记起；摆脱…的影响
vocab.ex: He will never live down that embarrassing moment from the party.
She has an obsession with collecting rare stamps.

gram.name: 短语动词 (live down)
gram.pattern: (not) live something down
gram.function: 这是一个习语化的短语动词，几乎总是用于否定句中，表示无法让人们忘记自己过去做的某件尴尬或愚蠢的事。'...will never live down their... obsession' 强调了中学里的“标签”是多么持久和难以摆脱。

example.en: If you wear that ridiculous costume, you'll never live it down.
example.cn: 如果你穿那件可笑的戏服，你将永远被人取笑。

gram.constraints: 几乎总是与 'never', 'can't', 或 'not able to' 连用。

paras.en: So I was actually trying to ease out of the whole Star Wars thing a bit. I mean, it'll always be special to me, like it is with the doctor who put in my hearing aids. It's just not the thing I wanted to be known for in middle school. I'm not sure what I want to be known for, but it's not that.
paras.cn: 所以我其实在试着慢慢淡出整个《星球大战》这件事。我的意思是，它对我来说永远是特别的，就像它对给我装助听器的那个医生一样。它只是我不想在中学里因此而出名的事情。我不确定我想以什么出名，但不是那个。

vocab.ex: After many years, she decided to ease out of her role as CEO.
I'm tired of the whole studying-for-exams thing.
This gift is very special to me because my grandfather gave it to me.

gram.name: 通过否定来定义身份
gram.pattern: I'm not sure what I want..., but it's not that.
gram.function: 在青少年探索身份的过程中，常常更容易确定“我不想成为什么”，而不是“我想成为什么”。句子 'I'm not sure what I want to be known for, but it's not that.' 完美地捕捉了这种通过排除法来寻找自我的心理状态。

example.en: He doesn't know what career he wants, but he knows it's not an office job.
example.cn: 他不知道自己想要什么职业，但他知道那不是一份办公室工作。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、表达探索和不确定性的方式。

paras.en: That's not exactly true: I do know what I'm really known for. But there's nothing I can do about that. A Star Wars duffel bag I could do something about.
paras.cn: 那不完全是真的：我确实知道我真正出名的是什么。但对此我无能为力。一个星球大战行李袋，我倒是能做点什么。

vocab.ex: His version of the story is not exactly true; he left out some important details.
That restaurant is known for its excellent seafood.
The noise is too loud; we need to do something about it.

gram.name: 对比与自主性
gram.pattern: [Unchangeable thing]... But [Changeable thing]...
gram.function: 通过两个结构平行的句子形成强烈对比：'But there's nothing I can do about that' (that 指代他的脸) 和 'A Star Wars duffel bag I could do something about'。这个对比深刻地揭示了主角的处境：他将精力集中在自己能够控制的小事上（行李袋），以此来应对那个他无法改变的、定义了他身份的核心事实（他的外貌）。

example.en: I can't change the past. But my future, I can do something about.
example.cn: 我无法改变过去。但我的未来，我倒是能做点什么。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比可控与不可控因素来揭示人物心理的有效技巧。

paras.en: Mom helped me pack the night before the big trip. We put all the clothes I was taking on my bed, and she folded everything neatly and put it inside the bag while I watched. It was a plain blue rolling duffel, by the way: no logos or artwork. "What if I can't sleep at night?" I asked. "Take a book with you. Then if you can't sleep, you can pull out your flashlight, and read for a bit until you get sleepy," she answered.
paras.cn: 在大旅行的前一天晚上，妈妈帮我打包。我们把我所有要带的衣服都放在床上，她在我看着的时候把所有东西都整齐地叠好放进包里。顺便说一下，那是一个朴素的蓝色带轮行李袋：没有标志或图案。“如果我晚上睡不着怎么办？” 我问。“带本书去。那样如果你睡不着，你可以拿出你的手电筒，读一会儿，直到你困了，” 她回答。

vocab.ex: He needs to pack his suitcase for the trip tomorrow.
She arranged the books neatly on the shelf.
He preferred wearing a plain white t-shirt.
The Nike logo is recognized all over the world.
Let's rest for a bit before we continue hiking.

gram.name: What if...? (用于表达担忧)
gram.pattern: What if + clause?
gram.function: 用于提出一个假设性的问题，通常是用来表达对未来可能发生的不良情况的担忧或焦虑。'What if I can't sleep at night?' 是主角对即将到来的旅行可能遇到的问题提出的担忧。

example.en: What if I miss the train?
example.cn: 如果我错过了火车怎么办？

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的表达忧虑的方式。

paras.en: I nodded. "What if I have a nightmare?" "Your teachers will be there, sweetie," she said. "And Jack. And your friends." "I can bring Baboo," I said. That was my favorite stuffed animal when I was little. A small black bear with a soft black nose. "You don't really sleep with him anymore, do you?" said Mom. "No, but I keep him in my closet in case I wake up in the middle of the night and can't get back to sleep," I said. "I could hide him in my bag. No one would know." "Then let's do that." Mom nodded, getting Baboo from inside my closet.
paras.cn: 我点了点头。“如果我做噩梦怎么办？” “你的老师会在那儿的，宝贝，” 她说。“还有杰克。还有你的朋友们。” “我可以带上巴布，” 我说。那是我小时候最喜欢的毛绒玩具。一只长着柔软黑鼻子的小黑熊。“你现在已经不怎么和他一起睡了，对吧？” 妈妈说。“是的，但我把他放在我的衣柜里，以防我半夜醒来睡不着，” 我说。“我可以把他藏在包里。没人会知道的。” “那就这么做吧。” 妈妈点了点头，从我衣柜里拿出了巴布。

vocab.ex: He woke up screaming from a terrible nightmare.
Her bed was covered with stuffed animals.
You should bring an umbrella, just in case it rains.

vocab.word: in the middle of the night
vocab.ex: The phone rang in the middle of the night and woke everyone up.

gram.name: 附加疑问句（否定）
gram.pattern: Positive Statement, + don't/doesn't + pronoun?
gram.function: 附加在陈述句后，用于寻求对方的确认。妈妈说 'You don't really sleep with him anymore, do you?'，她其实是在陈述一个她认为的事实，并希望得到主角的确认。

example.en: You like pizza, don't you?
example.cn: 你喜欢披萨，对吧？

gram.constraints: 通常遵循“前肯后否，前否后肯”的原则。

paras.en: "I wish they allowed cell phones," I said. "I know, me too!" she said. "Though I know you're going to have a great time, Auggie. You sure you want me to pack Baboo?" "Yeah, but way down where no one can see him," I said. She stuck Baboo deep inside the bag and then stuffed the last of my T-shirts on top of him. "So many clothes for just two days!" "Three days and two nights," I corrected her. "Yep." She nodded, smiling. "Three days and two nights." She zipped up the duffel bag and picked it up. "Not too heavy. Try it." I picked up the bag. "Fine." I shrugged.
paras.cn: “我希望他们允许带手机，” 我说。“我知道，我也是！” 她说。“不过我知道你会玩得很开心的，奥吉。你确定要我把巴布装进去吗？” “是的，但是要放在最下面，没人能看到的地方，” 我说。她把巴布塞进包的深处，然后把最后几件T恤塞在他上面。“才两天就带这么多衣服！” “三天两夜，” 我纠正她。“是的。” 她点着头，微笑着。“三天两夜。” 她拉上行李袋的拉链，把它提了起来。“不太重。你试试。” 我提起包。“还行。” 我耸了耸肩。

vocab.ex: My parents don't allow me to stay out late on school nights.
He hid the gift way down at the bottom of the closet.
Just stick the book on that shelf for now.
She stuffed her clothes into the small suitcase.
The teacher corrected the student's pronunciation.
Could you help me zip up the back of my dress?

gram.name: wish + 过去时
gram.pattern: wish + Subject + past simple
gram.function: 用于表达与现在事实相反的愿望。'I wish they allowed cell phones' 表达了主角希望“现在”的规定与现实不同的愿望。

example.en: I wish I had more free time.
example.cn: 我希望我有更多的空闲时间。

gram.constraints: 从句中的动词使用一般过去时，表示与现在事实相反的虚拟语气。

paras.en: She sat on the bed. "Hey, what happened to your Empire Strikes Back poster?" "Oh, I took that down ages ago," I answered. She shook her head. "Huh, I didn't notice that before." "I'm trying to, you know, change my image a bit," I explained. "Okay." She smiled, nodding like she understood. "Anyway, honey, you have to promise me you won't forget to put on the bug spray, okay? On the legs, especially when you're hiking through the woods. It's right here in the front compartment."
paras.cn: 她坐在床上。“嘿，你那张《帝国反击战》的海报怎么了？” “哦，我很久以前就拿下来了，” 我回答。她摇了摇头。“咦，我以前没注意到。” “我正在试着，你知道，改变一下我的形象，” 我解释道。“好的。” 她笑了，点着头，像她明白了一样。“总之，宝贝，你得答应我你不会忘了喷防虫喷雾，好吗？喷在腿上，尤其是在树林里徒步的时候。它就在这里，前面的隔层里。”

vocab.ex: He has a poster of his favorite band on his bedroom wall.
It's time to take down the Christmas decorations.
I saw that movie ages ago.
Politicians work hard to maintain a positive public image.
Don't forget to use bug spray when you go camping.
I keep my keys in the small front compartment of my backpack.

gram.name: 话语标记 (you know)
gram.pattern: ..., you know, ...
gram.function: 在对话中用作填充词或寻求听者的理解和认同。'...I'm trying to, you know, change my image...' 中的 'you know' 是一种非正式的方式，用来连接思路，并下意识地确认对方是否跟上了自己的想法。

example.en: It was a really difficult situation, you know?
example.cn: 那情况真的很困难，你懂吧？

gram.constraints: 主要用于非正式对话中。

paras.en: "Uh-huh." "And put on your sunscreen," she said. "You do not want to get a sunburn. And don't, I repeat, do not forget to take your hearing aids off if you go swimming." "Would I get electrocuted?" "No, but you'd be in real hot water with Daddy because those things cost a fortune!" she laughed. "I put the rain poncho in the front compartment, too. Same thing goes if it rains, Auggie, okay? Make sure you cover the hearing aids with the hood." "Aye, aye, sir," I said, saluting.
paras.cn: “嗯哼。” “还有要涂防晒霜，” 她说。“你可不想被晒伤。还有，不要，我重复一遍，不要忘了如果你去游泳，要把助听器摘下来。” “我会触电吗？” “不会，但你会惹上爸爸的大麻烦，因为那些东西花了一大笔钱！” 她笑了。“我也把雨披放在前面的隔层里了。如果下雨也是一样，奥吉，好吗？确保用兜帽盖住助听器。” “是，长官，” 我说，敬了个礼。

vocab.ex: You should always put on sunscreen before going to the beach.
He got a bad sunburn after falling asleep on the beach.
It's dangerous to use electrical appliances near water because you could get electrocuted.
He'll be in hot water if his boss finds out he was late again.
That diamond ring must have cost a fortune.
It started raining, so we put on our plastic ponchos.
You must be on time for work, and the same thing goes if you have a meeting.
The soldier raised his hand to salute the officer.

gram.name: 使用 'I repeat' 进行强调
gram.pattern: ..., I repeat, ...
gram.function: 用于在重复一个指令或陈述时，极大地强调其重要性。'And don't, I repeat, do not forget...' 是一种非常强硬的强调方式，表明妈妈对这件事的极度重视。

example.en: You must not, I repeat, must not open that door.
example.cn: 你绝不能，我重复一遍，绝不能打开那扇门。

gram.constraints: 是一种在口头指令中常见的强调手法。

paras.en: She smiled and pulled me over. "I can't believe how much you've grown up this year, Auggie," she said softly, putting her hands on the sides of my face. "Do I look taller?" "Definitely." She nodded. "I'm still the shortest one in my grade." "I'm not really even talking about your height," she said. "Suppose I hate it there?" "You're going to have a great time, Auggie." I nodded. She got up and gave me a quick kiss on the forehead. "Okay, so I say we get to bed now."
paras.cn: 她笑了笑，把我拉了过去。“我真不敢相信你今年长大了这么多，奥吉，” 她轻声说，把手放在我的脸颊两侧。“我看起来更高了吗？” “当然。” 她点了点头。“我仍然是我们年级最矮的。” “我其实甚至不是在说你的身高，” 她说。“假如我讨厌那里怎么办？” “你会玩得很开心的，奥吉。” 我点了点头。她站起来，在我额头上轻轻亲了一下。“好了，那么我说我们现在该上床了。”

vocab.ex: She pulled him over for a private conversation.
It's time for you to grow up and take responsibility.
I will definitely be at your party on Saturday.
He is proud of his height.
Suppose you won the lottery, what would you do first?

gram.name: 区分身体与情感成长
gram.pattern: Contrast between physical and non-physical attributes.
gram.function: 通过对话的交错，作者揭示了母子两人对“成长”的不同理解。主角首先从物理层面（'Do I look taller?'）来理解，而妈妈则通过 'I'm not really even talking about your height' 将对话引向了更深层次的、关于情感和心理上的成熟。这种对比突显了妈妈对儿子内在成长的欣慰。

example.en: He may be small in stature, but he has a giant heart.
example.cn: 他虽然身材矮小，但却有一颗伟大的心。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中揭示深层含义的技巧。

paras.en: "It's only nine o'clock, Mom!" "Your bus leaves at six a.m. tomorrow. You don't want to be late. Come on. Chop chop. Your teeth are brushed?" I nodded and climbed into bed. She started to lie down next to me. "You don't need to put me to bed tonight, Mom," I said. "I'll read on my own till I get sleepy." "Really?" She nodded, impressed. She squeezed my hand and gave it a kiss. "Okay then, goodnight, love. Have sweet dreams." "You too."
paras.cn: “才九点钟，妈妈！” “你明天早上六点巴士就开了。你可不想迟到。快点。快点快点。牙刷了吗？” 我点了点头，爬上了床。她开始要躺到我旁边。“你今晚不用哄我睡觉了，妈妈，” 我说。“我会自己看书，直到困了。” “真的吗？” 她点了点头，印象深刻。她捏了捏我的手，亲了一下。“那好吧，晚安，宝贝。做个好梦。” “你也是。”

vocab.ex: Come on, chop chop! We're going to be late.
He was so tired he just climbed into bed and fell asleep immediately.
She's very independent and likes to do things on her own.
The judges were very impressed with her performance.
Good night and sweet dreams!

gram.name: 独立性的展现
gram.pattern: A character rejecting a long-standing routine.
gram.function: 主角通过说 'You don't need to put me to bed tonight, Mom'，主动打破了一个长期存在的、带有“孩子气”的家庭常规。这个小小的行为是一个重要的里程碑，具体地展示了他情感上的成长和日益增强的独立性，与前一晚他爬进妈妈床上的行为形成对比。

example.en: "I can tie my own shoes now," the little boy said proudly.
example.cn: “我现在能自己系鞋带了，” 小男孩骄傲地说。

gram.constraints: 是通过行为而非直接陈述来展示角色成长的有效技巧。

paras.en: She turned on the little reading light beside the bed. "I'll write you letters," I said as she was leaving. "Even though I'll probably be home before you guys even get them." "Then we can read them together," she said, and threw me a kiss. When she left my room, I took my copy of The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe off the night table and started reading until I fell asleep. . . . though the Witch knew the Deep Magic, there is a magic deeper still which she did not know. Her knowledge goes back only to the dawn of time. But if she could have looked a little further back, into the stillness and the darkness before Time dawned, she would have read there a different incantation.
paras.cn: 她打开了床边的小阅读灯。“我会给你们写信的，” 她正要离开时我说。“即使我可能在你们收到信之前就已经到家了。” “那我们就可以一起读了，” 她说，并给了我一个飞吻。她离开我的房间后，我从床头柜上拿起我的那本《狮子、女巫和魔衣橱》，开始阅读，直到睡着。“……虽然女巫知道深层魔法，但还有一种她所不知道的、更深的魔法。她的知识只回溯到时间的黎明。但如果她能看得更远一点，看到时间破晓前的寂静与黑暗，她会在那里读到一种不同的咒语。”

vocab.ex: He turned on the small reading light above his bed.
As the train pulled away, she threw him a final kiss.
In the fantasy world, only the oldest beings understood the deep magic.
The stillness of the forest was broken by the sound of a bird.
The wizard muttered a strange incantation to cast the spell.

gram.name: 通过引文进行主题预示
gram.pattern: Ending a chapter with a thematically relevant quote from another work.
gram.function: 章节以一段来自《纳尼亚传奇》的引文结尾。这段关于“更深的魔法”的文字，不仅是主角睡前阅读的内容，更在主题上起到了预示作用。它暗示了在即将到来的自然静修中，可能会有一种超越表面规则（“深层魔法”）的、更深层次的力量（如友谊、勇气、善良）在起作用，这预示着即将发生的事件将具有深刻的意义。

example.en: He closed the book. The last line echoed in his mind: 'It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done.'
example.cn: 他合上书。最后一行在他的脑海中回响：“我所做的是一件远比我做过的任何事都好的事。”

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的文学技巧，用于增加文本的层次感和象征意义。

paras.en: The next day I woke up really early. It was still dark inside my room and even darker outside, though I knew it would be morning soon. I turned over on my side but didn't feel at all sleepy. That's when I saw Daisy sitting near my bed. I mean, I knew it wasn't Daisy, but for a second I saw a shadow that looked just like her. I didn't think it was a dream then, but now, looking back, I know it must have been. It didn't make me sad to see her at all: it just filled me up with nice feelings inside. She was gone after a second, and I couldn't see her again in the darkness.
paras.cn: 第二天我醒得很早。我的房间里还很黑，外面更黑，尽管我知道很快就是早晨了。我翻了个身，但一点也不困。就在那时，我看到黛西坐在我的床边。我的意思是，我知道那不是黛西，但有一瞬间我看到了一个和她一模一样的影子。那时我不认为那是个梦，但现在回想起来，我知道那一定是个梦。看到她一点也没让我难过：它只是让我的内心充满了美好的感觉。一秒钟后她就消失了，我在黑暗中再也看不到她了。

vocab.ex: He turned over in his sleep and started snoring.
After the big meal, everyone felt sleepy.
The tall tree cast a long shadow across the yard.
Looking back, I realize it was a silly argument.
The good news filled him up with hope for the future.

gram.name: 情态动词推测 (must have been)
gram.pattern: must have + past participle
gram.function: 用于对过去发生的事情进行非常肯定的推测或推断。'...I know it must have been [a dream]' 表达了主角在事后对自己所见情景的理性判断。

example.en: The streets are all wet. It must have rained last night.
example.cn: 街道都湿了。昨晚肯定下雨了。

gram.constraints: 只用于对过去事件的推测。

paras.en: The room slowly started lightening. I reached for my hearing aid headband and put it on, and now the world was really awake. I could hear the garbage trucks clunking down the street and the birds in our backyard. And down the hallway I heard Mom's alarm beeping. Daisy's ghost made me feel super strong inside, knowing wherever I am, she'd be there with me.
paras.cn: 房间慢慢地开始亮起来。我伸手拿起我的助听器头带戴上，现在世界真的醒了。我能听到垃圾车在街上哐当作响，还有我们后院的鸟叫声。在走廊尽头，我听到了妈妈的闹钟在响。黛西的“鬼魂”让我内心感觉超级强大，因为我知道无论我在哪里，她都会和我在一起。

vocab.ex: As the sun rose, the sky began to lighten.
He reached for the book on the top shelf.
The old engine started to clunk and then stopped completely.
The children were playing in the backyard.
My alarm clock starts to beep at 6 a.m. every morning.
He felt the ghost of his past failures haunting him.

gram.name: 现在分词作原因状语
gram.pattern: Main Clause, + VERB-ing...
gram.function: 用于解释主句动作或状态的原因。在此句中，分词短语 'knowing wherever I am, she'd be there with me' 解释了主角为什么会 'feel super strong inside'。

example.en: Knowing the answer, she confidently raised her hand.
example.cn: 因为知道答案，她自信地举起了手。

gram.constraints: 分词的逻辑主语必须是主句的主语。

paras.en: I got up out of bed and went to my desk and wrote a little note to Mom. Then I went into the living room, where my packed bag was by the door. I opened it up and fished inside until I found what I was looking for. I took Baboo back to my room, and I laid him in my bed and taped the little note to Mom on his chest. And then I covered him with my blanket so Mom would find him later. The note read: Dear Mom, I won't need Baboo, but if you miss me, you can cuddle with him yourself. XO Auggie
paras.cn: 我下了床，走到我的书桌前，给妈妈写了一张小纸条。然后我走进客厅，我打包好的包就在门边。我打开它，在里面翻找，直到找到我要找的东西。我把巴布带回我的房间，把他放在我的床上，然后把给妈妈的小纸条粘在他的胸前。然后我用我的毯子把他盖上，这样妈妈晚些时候就能找到他。纸条上写着：亲爱的妈妈，我不需要巴布了，但如果你想我，你可以自己抱抱他。亲亲抱抱 奥吉

vocab.ex: She left a note on the kitchen table to say she would be late.
His packed suitcase was waiting by the door.
She was fishing inside her purse, looking for her keys.
He used some tape to fix the torn page of the book.
The little girl loves to cuddle with her teddy bear at night.
She signed the birthday card, 'Love, Sarah XO'.

gram.name: 象征性的成熟姿态
gram.pattern: A character gives away a comfort object to comfort another.
gram.function: 主角不再需要他的安抚玩具（Baboo），反而将其作为安慰物留给妈妈。这个行为是一个重要的、象征性的姿态，标志着角色的转变：他从一个需要被安慰的孩子，成长为一个能够理解并试图安慰他人（妈妈）的人。这体现了他的同理心和情感上的成熟。

example.en: The child, seeing his mother was sad, gave her his favorite toy 'to keep her company.'
example.cn: 那个孩子看到妈妈很难过，就把他最喜欢的玩具给了她，“让它陪着她”。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过具体行为来展示角色内心成长的有效叙事技巧。

paras.en: The bus ride went really fast. I sat by the window and Jack was next to me in the aisle seat. Summer and Maya were in front of us. Everyone was in a good mood. Kind of loud, laughing a lot. I noticed right away that Julian wasn't on our bus, even though Henry and Miles were. I figured he must be on the other bus, but then I overheard Miles tell Amos that Julian ditched the grade trip because he thought the whole nature-retreat thing was, quote unquote, dorky. I got totally pumped because dealing with Julian for three days in a row—and two nights—was a major reason that I was nervous about this whole trip. So now without him there, I could really just relax and not worry about anything.
paras.cn: 巴士旅程过得真快。我坐在靠窗的位置，杰克在我旁边的过道座位。萨默和玛雅在我们前面。大家心情都很好。有点吵，笑声很多。我立刻就注意到朱利安不在我们的巴士上，尽管亨利和迈尔斯在。我琢磨着他肯定在另一辆巴士上，但后来我无意中听到迈尔斯告诉阿莫斯，朱利安退出了这次年级旅行，因为他觉得整个自然静修活动，所谓的，很傻。我一下子兴奋极了，因为连续三天——还有两夜——要和朱利安打交道，是我对这次旅行感到紧张的一个主要原因。所以现在没他在，我真的可以放松下来，什么也不用担心了。

vocab.ex: He prefers the aisle seat so he can stretch his legs.
She was in a good mood after receiving the good news.
I happened to overhear their conversation about the secret party.
He decided to ditch his old friends and find new ones.

vocab.mean: 所谓的（口头语，用于表示引用或讽刺）
vocab.ex: He told me it was his, quote unquote, 'masterpiece'.
He loves wearing his dorky old hat from college.
The team was pumped before the big game.
It has rained for three days in a row.

gram.name: 动名词短语作主语
gram.pattern: VERB-ing + ... + is/was + complement.
gram.function: 将一个动作或事件（'dealing with Julian for three days...'）作为整个句子的主语。这是一种将动作名词化的常见方式。

example.en: Learning a new language is a rewarding experience.
example.cn: 学习一门新语言是一种有益的经历。

gram.constraints: 动名词短语作主语时，谓语动词通常用单数形式。

paras.en: We got to the nature reserve at around noon. The first thing we did was put our stuff down in the cabins. There were three bunk beds to every room, so me and Jack did rock, paper, scissors for the top bunk and I won. Woo-hoo. And the other guys in the room were Reid and Tristan, and Pablo and Nino.
paras.cn: 我们大约在中午时分到达了自然保护区。我们做的第一件事是把我们的东西放在小木屋里。每个房间有三张双层床，所以我和杰克玩了石头剪刀布来决定谁睡上铺，我赢了。喔呼。房间里的其他男生是里德和特里斯坦，还有巴勃罗和尼诺。

vocab.ex: We went hiking in the nearby nature reserve to see wildlife.
Let's meet for lunch at around noon.
They stayed in a cozy cabin in the mountains for their vacation.
The two brothers shared a room with a bunk bed.
Let's play rock, paper, scissors to decide who goes first.
"I won the lottery!" "Woo-hoo! That's amazing!"

gram.name: 强调句型 (The first thing... was...)
gram.pattern: The first thing + Subject + did + was + [emphasized action]
gram.function: 用于强调一系列动作中的第一个或最重要的一个。'The first thing we did was put our stuff down...' 强调了他们到达后立即采取的行动。

example.en: The first thing I do every morning is make a cup of coffee.
example.cn: 我每天早上做的第一件事就是冲一杯咖啡。

gram.constraints: 后面的不定式 'to put' 中的 'to' 通常被省略。

paras.en: After we had lunch in the main cabin, we all went on a twohour guided nature hike through the woods. But these were not woods like the kind they have in Central Park: these were real woods. Giant trees that almost totally blocked out the sunlight. Tangles of leaves and fallen tree trunks. Howls and chirps and really loud bird calls. There was a slight fog, too, like a pale blue smoke all around us. So cool. The nature guide pointed everything out to us: the different types of trees we were passing, the insects inside the dead logs on the trail, the signs of deer and bears in the woods, what types of birds were whistling and where to look for them. I realized that my Lobot hearing aids actually made me hear better than most people, because I was usually the first person to hear a new bird call.
paras.cn: 在主小屋吃完午饭后，我们都参加了一个两小时的有向导的林间自然徒步。但这不是像中央公园里那种树林：这是真正的树林。巨大的树木几乎完全挡住了阳光。纠结的树叶和倒下的树干。嚎叫声、啾啾声和非常响亮的鸟鸣声。还有一层薄雾，像淡蓝色的烟雾环绕着我们。太酷了。自然向导向我们指出了所有东西：我们经过的不同种类的树木，小径上枯木里的昆虫，树林里鹿和熊的迹象，哪些种类的鸟在鸣叫以及去哪里寻找它们。我意识到我的洛博特助听器实际上让我比大多数人听得更清楚，因为我通常是第一个听到新鸟叫声的人。

vocab.ex: We signed up for a guided hike to learn about the local plants.
The thick curtains block out the morning sunlight.
I spent an hour trying to untie the tangle of wires behind the TV.
He carved his initials into the tree trunk.
I love waking up to the sound of birds chirping outside my window.

gram.name: 连接词省略与感官细节
gram.pattern: A series of descriptive phrases without conjunctions.
gram.function: 通过省略并列连词，作者用一系列快速、碎片化的名词短语（'Giant trees...', 'Tangles of leaves...', 'Howls and chirps...'）来描绘森林的景象。这种手法不仅创造了丰富的感官体验（视觉、听觉），还模仿了人们在面对密集信息时快速处理印象的方式，使描述更生动、更有冲击力。

example.en: The city at night: flashing lights, honking cars, distant sirens.
example.cn: 夜晚的城市：闪烁的灯光，鸣笛的汽车，远处的警报声。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过省略来增强节奏感和画面感的修辞技巧。

paras.en: It started to rain as we headed back to camp. I pulled on my rain poncho and pulled the hood up so my hearing aids wouldn't get wet, but my jeans and shoes got soaked by the time we reached our cabins. Everyone got soaked. It was fun, though. We had a wet-sock fight in the cabin.
paras.cn: 我们返回营地时开始下雨了。我穿上我的雨披，拉起兜帽，这样我的助听器就不会湿了，但等我们到达小木屋时，我的牛仔裤和鞋子都湿透了。每个人都湿透了。不过，这很有趣。我们在小木屋里打了一场湿袜子仗。

vocab.ex: It's getting late; we should head back home.
It started raining, so we put on our plastic ponchos.
He pulled up the hood of his sweatshirt to protect his head from the rain.
We got caught in the storm and were soaked to the skin.

gram.name: 目的状语从句 (so)
gram.pattern: Main clause + so + clause of purpose
gram.function: 用于解释主句动作的目的。'...pulled the hood up so my hearing aids wouldn't get wet' 解释了“拉起兜帽”这个动作的目的。

example.en: I studied hard so I could pass the exam.
example.cn: 我努力学习，以便能通过考试。

gram.constraints: 在非正式语境中，'that' 常常被省略。

paras.en: Since it rained for the rest of the day, we spent most of the afternoon goofing off in the rec room. They had a Ping-Pong table and old-style arcade games like Pac-Man and Missile Command that we played until dinnertime. Luckily, by then it had stopped raining, so we got to have a real campfire cookout. The log benches around the campfire were still a little damp, but we threw our jackets over them and hung out by the fire, toasting s'mores and eating the best roasted hot dogs I have ever, ever tasted.
paras.cn: 由于剩下的大半天都在下雨，我们大部分下午时间都在娱乐室里瞎闹。那里有一张乒乓球桌和像《吃豆人》、《导弹指挥官》那样的老式街机游戏，我们一直玩到晚饭时间。幸运的是，到那时雨已经停了，所以我们得以进行一次真正的篝火野餐。篝火周围的原木长凳还有点潮，但我们把夹克扔在上面，围在火边玩，烤着巧克力棉花糖夹心饼干，吃着我尝过的最最最好吃的烤热狗。

vocab.ex: Instead of doing his homework, he spent the afternoon goofing off with his friends.
The basement was converted into a rec room with a TV and a pool table.
He loves playing classic arcade games from the 1980s.
We're having a family cookout in the backyard on Saturday.
The morning air was cold and damp.
They sat by the fire toasting marshmallows.

gram.name: 最高级（含现在完成时和重复）
gram.pattern: the + superlative + ... + I have ever + past participle
gram.function: 用于强调某物是说话者经历过的“最…”的事物。通过重复 'ever, ever'，这种强调被进一步放大，传达出一种孩子气的、极其强烈的赞叹。

example.en: This is the most incredible magic trick I have ever, ever seen.
example.cn: 这是我见过的最最最不可思议的魔术。

gram.constraints: 重复 'ever' 是非正式的口语化强调方式。

paras.en: Mom was right about the mosquitoes: there were tons of them. But luckily I had spritzed myself before I left the cabin, and I wasn't eaten alive like some of the other kids were. I loved hanging out by the campfire after dark. I loved the way bits of fire dust would float up and disappear into the night air. And how the fire lit up people's faces. I loved the sound the fire made, too. And how the woods were so dark that you couldn't see anything around you, and you'd look up and see a billion stars in the sky. The sky doesn't look like that in North River Heights. I've seen it look like that in Montauk, though: like someone sprinkled salt on a shiny black table.
paras.cn: 妈妈关于蚊子的说法是对的：有成吨的蚊子。但幸运的是，我在离开小木屋前给自己喷了防蚊液，没有像其他一些孩子那样被活活吃掉。我喜欢天黑后在篝火旁玩。我喜欢火星飘向空中然后消失在夜色中的样子。还有火光照亮人们脸庞的样子。我也喜欢火发出的声音。还有树林是那么黑，以至于你什么也看不见，然后你抬头，会看到天空中亿万颗星星。在北河高地，天空不是那样的。不过，我在蒙托克见过它那样：就像有人在闪亮的黑桌子上撒了盐一样。

vocab.ex: I got bitten by a mosquito last night.
There were tons of people at the concert.
She spritzed some perfume on her neck.
We forgot bug spray and were eaten alive by mosquitoes on our camping trip.
The fireworks lit up the night sky.
She sprinkled some cheese on top of the pasta.

gram.name: 首语重复法（用于表达喜爱）
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase to list liked things.
gram.function: 通过重复 'I loved...' 和相似的结构 'And how...'，作者建立了一种抒情的、诗意的节奏，层层递进地列举了主角在篝火旁所喜爱的一切事物。这种手法有力地传达了他深刻的愉悦感和对这一刻的珍视。

example.en: I love the smell of rain. I love the sound it makes on the roof. I love how everything looks clean afterwards.
example.cn: 我爱雨的味道。我爱它敲打屋顶的声音。我爱雨后万物看起来焕然一新的样子。

gram.constraints: 是一种强有力的修辞手法，用于强调和增强情感。

paras.en: I was so tired when I got back to the cabin that I didn't need to pull out the book to read. I fell asleep almost as fast as my head hit the pillow. And maybe I dreamed about the stars, I don't know.
paras.cn: 我回到小木屋时太累了，以至于我都不需要拿出书来读。我几乎头一沾枕头就睡着了。也许我梦到了星星，我不知道。

vocab.ex: He pulled out his wallet to pay for the coffee.
She can run as fast as her older brother.

vocab.mean: 头一沾到枕头（指很快入睡）
vocab.ex: After the long hike, he was so exhausted that he hit the pillow and fell asleep instantly.

gram.name: so... that... 结果状语从句
gram.pattern: so + adj/adv + that + result clause
gram.function: 用于强调程度之深以至于产生了某种结果。'I was so tired... that I didn't need to pull out the book...' 强调了疲劳的程度及其导致的后果（直接入睡）。

example.en: The movie was so boring that I fell asleep.
example.cn: 那部电影太无聊了，我都睡着了。

gram.constraints: 从句'that' 有时在口语中可以省略，但书面语中通常保留。

paras.en: The next day was just as great as the first day. We went horseback riding in the morning, and in the afternoon we rappelled up some ginormous trees with the help of the nature guides. By the time we got back to the cabins for dinner, we were all really tired again. After dinner they told us we had an hour to rest, and then we were going to take a fifteen-minute bus ride to the fairgrounds for an outdoor movie night. I hadn't had the chance to write a letter to Mom and Dad and Via yet, so I wrote one telling them all about the stuff we did that day and the day before. I pictured myself reading it to them out loud when I got back, since there was just no way the letter would get home before I did.
paras.cn: 第二天和第一天一样棒。我们早上骑了马，下午在自然向导的帮助下，我们沿着一些巨大的树木进行了绳索下降。等我们回到小木屋吃晚饭时，我们都又非常累了。晚饭后，他们告诉我们有一个小时的休息时间，然后我们要坐十五分钟的巴士去露天市场参加一个户外电影之夜。我还没来得及给爸爸妈妈和维娅写信，所以我写了一封，告诉他们那天和前一天我们做的所有事情。我想象着我回来后大声读给他们听的情景，因为信件绝不可能在我到家之前寄到。

vocab.ex: She learned horseback riding at a summer camp.

vocab.mean: （借助绳索）沿悬崖或墙壁下降
vocab.ex: The soldiers had to rappel down the steep cliff.
He ordered a ginormous pizza that could feed the whole family.
The annual county fair is held at the local fairgrounds.
I can't picture myself living in a big city.
There's no way I'm going outside in this terrible storm.

gram.name: By the time... (时间状语从句)
gram.pattern: By the time + clause, + main clause.
gram.function: 用于表示“到…的时候”，引出一个时间终点，主句的动作在该时间点已经发生或处于某种状态。'By the time we got back..., we were all really tired' 清晰地表明了“疲劳”这个状态是在“回到小木屋”时已经存在的。

example.en: By the time I arrived at the party, most of the guests had already left.
example.cn: 我到派对的时候，大部分客人都已经走了。

gram.constraints: 主句通常使用完成时态或一般过去时。

paras.en: When we got to the fairgrounds, the sun was just starting to set. It was about seven-thirty. The shadows were really long on the grass, and the clouds were pink and orange. It looked like someone had taken sidewalk chalk and smudged the colors across the sky with their fingers. It's not that I haven't seen nice sunsets before in the city, because I have—slivers of sunsets between buildings—but I wasn't used to seeing so much sky in every direction. Out here in the fairgrounds, I could understand why ancient people used to think the world was flat and the sky was a dome that closed in on top of it. That's what it looked like from the fairgrounds, in the middle of this huge open field.
paras.cn: 我们到达露天市场时，太阳刚开始下山。大约是七点半。草地上的影子拉得很长，云彩是粉色和橙色的。看起来就像有人拿了人行道粉笔，用手指把颜色涂抹在天空中。不是说我以前在城市里没见过美丽的日落，因为我见过——建筑物之间的日落碎片——但我只是不习惯在每个方向都看到这么多的天空。在这里，在露天市场，我能理解为什么古人会认为世界是平的，天空是一个盖在上面的穹顶。从这片巨大开阔田野中间的露天市场看去，就是那个样子。

vocab.ex: We sat on the beach and watched the sun set over the ocean.
The children decorated the driveway with colorful sidewalk chalk.
He smudged the ink on the letter before it was dry.
I only saw a sliver of the moon through the clouds.
The cathedral is famous for its magnificent dome.

gram.name: 扩展明喻与对比
gram.pattern: A vivid comparison followed by a contrast to previous experience.
gram.function: 作者首先用一个充满童趣和创意的明喻（'like someone had taken sidewalk chalk...'）来描绘日落，然后立即通过 'It's not that I haven't seen... but I wasn't used to...' 的结构，将其与在城市中看到的“日落碎片”（slivers of sunsets）进行对比。这种组合不仅创造了生动的画面，还深刻地表达了主角在开阔自然中获得的全新、完整的感官体验。

example.en: The silence was like a thick blanket. It's not that I haven't been in quiet places before, but this was a silence so deep you could almost hear it.
example.cn: 寂静如同一张厚厚的毯子。不是说我以前没待过安静的地方，但这种寂静深得你几乎能听到它。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来深化描述的有效技巧。

paras.en: Because we were the first school to arrive, we got to run around the field all we wanted until the teachers told us it was time to lay out our sleeping bags on the ground and get good viewing seats. We unzipped our bags and laid them down like picnic blankets on the grass in front of the giant movie screen in the middle of the field. Then we went to the row of food trucks parked at the edge of the field to load up on snacks and sodas and stuff like that. There were concession stands there, too, like at a farmers' market, selling roasted peanuts and cotton candy. And up a little farther was a short row of carnival-type stalls, the kind where you can win a stuffed animal if you throw a baseball into a basket. Jack and I both tried—and failed—to win anything, but we heard Amos won a yellow hippo and gave it to Ximena. That was the big gossip that went around: the jock and the brainiac.
paras.cn: 因为我们是第一所到达的学校，所以我们得以在田野里尽情地跑来跑去，直到老师告诉我们是时候把睡袋铺在地上，占个好观影位置了。我们拉开睡袋的拉链，像野餐毯一样把它们铺在田野中央巨大电影屏幕前的草地上。然后我们去了停在田野边缘的一排餐车，装上零食、苏打水之类的东西。那里也有小吃摊，就像在农贸市场一样，卖烤花生和棉花糖。再远一点是一小排嘉年华式的小摊位，就是那种如果你把棒球扔进篮子里就能赢得一个毛绒玩具的地方。我和杰克都试了——但没成功——什么也没赢得，但我们听说阿莫斯赢得了一只黄色的河马，并把它送给了西梅纳。那就是当时流传的大八卦：运动员和女学霸。

vocab.ex: He laid out a map on the table to plan their route.
Before the long road trip, they loaded up on snacks and drinks.
We bought popcorn and soda from the concession stand.
A trip to the fair isn't complete without some sticky cotton candy.
She bought some fresh vegetables from a stall at the market.
I don't like to listen to office gossip.
In many high school movies, the jock is the main character's rival.
She's a total brainiac who gets straight A's in every subject.

gram.name: 同位语（用于总结）
gram.pattern: Statement: + summary phrase.
gram.function: 使用一个简短的名词短语作为同位语，来对前面描述的事件进行概括和定性。在描述了阿莫斯把河马送给西梅纳之后，作者用 'the jock and the brainiac' 这个短语来总结这个八卦的核心内容，并给两个角色贴上了典型的校园标签。

example.en: The CEO announced her resignation: the end of an era.
example.cn: CEO宣布了她的辞职：一个时代的终结。

gram.constraints: 通常用冒号或破折号引出。

paras.en: From the food trucks, you could see the cornstalks in back of the movie screen. They covered about a third of the entire field. The rest of the field was completely surrounded by woods. As the sun sank lower in the sky, the tall trees at the entrance to the woods looked dark blue.
paras.cn: 从餐车那边，你可以看到电影屏幕后面的玉米秆。它们覆盖了整个田野的大约三分之一。田野的其余部分则完全被树林包围。随着太阳在天空中越沉越低，树林入口处的高大树木看起来呈深蓝色。

vocab.ex: The scarecrow was made of old clothes and cornstalks.
He ate about a third of the entire pizza by himself.
The small house was surrounded by tall trees.
We watched the moon sink lower towards the horizon.

gram.name: 描述性写作（场景设置）
gram.pattern: Using simple past and past continuous to paint a picture.
gram.function: 这个段落纯粹用于场景描述，没有情节推进。通过一系列客观的描述（'you could see...', 'They covered...', 'The rest... was surrounded...', 'the tall trees... looked dark blue'），作者为读者构建了一个宁静而富有画面感的黄昏景象，为接下来的事件营造了氛围。

example.en: The room was small. A single window looked out onto a quiet street. A desk sat in the corner, covered in papers.
example.cn: 房间很小。一扇窗户望向一条安静的街道。角落里放着一张书桌，上面堆满了文件。

gram.constraints: 依赖于具体的感官细节。

paras.en: By the time the other school buses pulled into the parking lots, we were back in our spots on the sleeping bags, right smack in front of the screen: the best seats in the whole field. Everyone was passing around snacks and having a great time. Me and Jack and Summer and Reid and Maya played Pictionary. We could hear the sounds of the other schools arriving, the loud laughing and talking of kids coming out on the field on both sides of us, but we couldn't really see them. Though the sky was still light, the sun had gone down completely, and everything on the ground had turned deep purple. The clouds were shadows now. We had trouble even seeing the Pictionary cards in front of us.
paras.cn: 等到其他学校的巴士驶入停车场时，我们已经回到了睡袋上的位置，就在屏幕的正前方：整个场地的最佳座位。大家都在传递零食，玩得很开心。我和杰克、萨默、里德、玛雅玩了猜图游戏。我们能听到其他学校到达的声音，孩子们在我们两侧走上场地的喧闹笑谈声，但我们并不能真正看到他们。虽然天空还亮着，但太阳已经完全下山了，地面上的一切都变成了深紫色。云彩现在成了影子。我们甚至很难看清面前的猜图卡片。

vocab.ex: The train slowly pulled into the station.
This is a perfect spot for a picnic.
He parked his car right smack in front of my driveway.
She passed around a plate of cookies for everyone to share.
We watched the sun go down over the horizon.

gram.name: 光线变化的描述
gram.pattern: Describing the process of dusk.
gram.function: 通过一系列对光线和颜色的精确描述（'sky was still light', 'sun had gone down', 'turned deep purple', 'clouds were shadows'），作者生动地捕捉了从黄昏到夜晚的过渡时刻。这种对环境变化的细腻观察，营造了一种宁静而又带有神秘感的氛围。

example.en: As evening approached, the golden light faded to a soft pink, and then a deep indigo.
example.cn: 随着傍晚的临近，金色的光芒褪为柔和的粉色，然后是深邃的靛蓝色。

gram.constraints: 依赖于具体的感官细节，尤其是视觉。

paras.en: Just then, without any announcement, all the lights at the ends of the field went on at once. They were like big bright stadium lights. I thought of that scene in Close Encounters when the alien ship lands and they're playing that music: duh-dah-doo-dadunnn. Everyone in the field started applauding and cheering like something great had just happened.
paras.cn: 就在那时，没有任何通知，场地上所有的灯一下子都亮了。它们就像巨大明亮的体育场灯光。我想起了《第三类接触》中外星飞船降落、他们播放那段音乐的场景：duh-dah-doo-da-dunnn。场地里的每个人都开始鼓掌欢呼，就好像刚发生了什么了不起的大事一样。

vocab.ex: I was about to leave, but just then, the phone rang.
All the lights in the building came on at once.
The concert was held in a giant football stadium.
The audience applauded loudly at the end of the performance.
The crowd started to cheer when their team scored a goal.

gram.name: 文化典故与拟声词
gram.pattern: Reference to a specific movie scene + sound effect.
gram.function: 通过引用著名科幻电影《第三类接触》中的经典场景，并模仿其标志性音乐（'duh-dah-doo-da-dunnn'），作者将一个普通的开灯瞬间，提升到了一个充满奇迹、敬畏和神秘感的层面。这种文化典故迅速地为读者建立了强烈的情感和视觉联想。

example.en: He entered the room slowly, like Darth Vader, and you could almost hear the 'Imperial March' playing.
example.cn: 他缓缓走进房间，就像达斯·维达一样，你几乎能听到《帝国进行曲》在播放。

gram.constraints: 其效果依赖于读者对所引用文化的熟悉程度。

paras.en: An announcement came over the huge speakers next to the stadium lights: "Welcome, everyone. Welcome to the twenty-third annual Big Movie Night at the Broarwood Nature Reserve. Welcome, teachers and students from . . . MS 342: the William Heath School. . . ." A big cheer went up on the left side of the field. "Welcome, teachers and students from Glover Academy. . . ." Another cheer went up, this time from the right side of the field. "And welcome, teachers and students from . . . the Beecher Prep School!" Our whole group cheered as loudly as we could.
paras.cn: 体育场灯光旁的巨大扬声器里传来了通知：“欢迎大家。欢迎来到布罗伍德自然保护区第二十三届年度大型电影之夜。欢迎来自……MS 342：威廉·希思学校的老师和同学们……” 场地的左侧爆发出巨大的欢呼声。“欢迎来自格洛弗学院的老师和同学们……” 又一阵欢呼声响起，这次来自场地的右侧。“以及欢迎来自……比彻预备学校的老师和同学们！” 我们整个团体都尽可能大声地欢呼起来。

vocab.ex: The principal made an important announcement over the loudspeaker.
The town holds an annual festival every summer.
A loud cheer erupted from the crowd when the team scored.
A great shout went up from the audience at the end of the concert.

gram.name: 首语重复法（用于正式欢迎）
gram.pattern: Repetition of 'Welcome...' at the beginning of successive phrases.
gram.function: 通过在欢迎不同团体时重复使用 'Welcome...'，播音员建立了一种正式、庄重而又充满节奏感的欢迎仪式。这种首语重复法（anaphora）在正式演讲中很常见，用于列举和强调。

example.en: Welcome to our city. Welcome to our home. Welcome to our family.
example.cn: 欢迎来到我们的城市。欢迎来到我们的家。欢迎来到我们的家庭。

gram.constraints: 是一种在正式场合中常见的、用于构建结构的修辞手法。

paras.en: "We're thrilled to have you as our guests here tonight, and thrilled that the weather is cooperating—in fact, can you believe what a beautiful night this is?" Again, everyone whooped and hollered. "So as we prepare the movie, we do ask that you take a few moments to listen to this important announcement. The Broarwood Nature Reserve, as you know, is dedicated to preserving our natural resources and the environment. We ask that you leave no litter behind. Clean up after yourselves. Be kind to nature and it will be kind to you. We ask that you keep that in mind as you walk around the grounds. Do not venture beyond the orange cones at the edges of the fairgrounds. Do not go into the cornfields or the woods. Please keep the free roaming to a minimum. Even if you don't feel like watching the movie, your fellow students may feel otherwise, so please be courteous: no talking, no playing music, no running around. The restrooms are located on the other side of the concession stands. After the movie is over, it will be quite dark, so we ask that all of you stay with your schools as you make your way back to your buses. Teachers, there's usually at least one lost party on Big Movie Nights at Broarwood: don't let it happen to you!"
paras.cn: “今晚我们很高兴能有你们作为我们的客人，也很高兴天气如此配合——事实上，你们能相信这是一个多么美丽的夜晚吗？” 再一次，每个人都大声欢呼呐喊。“那么，在我们准备电影的时候，我们确实请求你们花一点时间听一下这个重要的通知。如你们所知，布罗伍德自然保护区致力于保护我们的自然资源和环境。我们请求你们不要留下任何垃圾。请自己清理干净。善待自然，自然也会善待你。我们请求你们在场地周围走动时记住这一点。不要冒险越过露天市场边缘的橙色圆锥筒。不要进入玉米地或树林。请将自由活动降到最低。即使你不想看电影，你的同学们可能不这么想，所以请保持礼貌：不要说话，不要放音乐，不要跑来跑去。洗手间位于小吃摊的另一侧。电影结束后，天会很黑，所以我们请求你们所有人在返回巴士的途中都和自己的学校待在一起。老师们，在布罗伍德的大型电影之夜通常至少会有一个走失的团体：别让这种事发生在你们身上！”

vocab.ex: She was thrilled to receive an invitation to the party.
If everyone cooperates, we can finish this project quickly.
The crowd began to whoop and cheer for their team.
He had to holler to be heard over the loud music.
It's important to preserve historical buildings.
Please don't leave any litter in the park.
Hikers are warned not to venture beyond the marked trail.
The staff at the hotel was very professional and courteous.

gram.name: 用于规则的祈使句序列
gram.pattern: A list of commands and prohibitions.
gram.function: 播音员通过一连串的祈使句（'leave no litter', 'Clean up', 'Be kind', 'Do not venture', 'Please keep...'）来清晰、直接地传达一系列规则和禁令。这种结构在发布指南或规定时非常常见且有效。

example.en: For the test: Read the questions carefully. Do not cheat. Check your answers before you finish.
example.cn: 关于考试：仔细阅读问题。不要作弊。完成前检查你的答案。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常直接的指令形式。

paras.en: Tonight's movie presentation will be . . . The Sound of Music ! I immediately started clapping, even though I'd seen it a few times before, because it was Via's favorite movie of all time. But I was surprised that a whole bunch of kids (not from Beecher) booed and hissed and laughed. Someone from the right side of the field even threw a soda can at the screen, which seemed to surprise Mr. Tushman. I saw him stand up and look in the direction of the can thrower, though I knew he couldn't see anything in the dark.
paras.cn: 今晚的电影放映将是……《音乐之声》！我立刻开始鼓掌，尽管我以前已经看过几次了，因为那曾是维娅一直以来最喜欢的电影。但我很惊讶，一大群孩子（不是比彻的）发出了嘘声、嘶声和嘲笑声。场地右侧甚至有人朝屏幕扔了一个汽水罐，这似乎让塔什曼先生很惊讶。我看到他站起来，朝扔罐子的人的方向看去，尽管我知道他在黑暗中什么也看不见。

vocab.ex: The evening's entertainment will be a special movie presentation.
She is considered one of the greatest singers of all time.
A whole bunch of people were waiting outside the store.
The crowd started to boo when the referee made a bad call.
The audience hissed at the villain in the play.

gram.name: 对比反应
gram.pattern: Positive reaction from one group vs. negative reaction from another.
gram.function: 通过将主角的积极反应（'immediately started clapping'）与另一群孩子的消极反应（'booed and hissed and laughed'）进行直接对比，作者突显了不同群体之间的态度差异，并暗示了潜在的冲突或不和谐。

example.en: Some people loved the new policy, while others protested against it.
example.cn: 一些人喜爱这项新政策，而另一些人则对其表示抗议。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中展现群体动态和冲突的有效技巧。

paras.en: The movie started playing right away. The stadium lights dimmed. Maria the nun was standing at the top of the mountain twirling around and around. It had gotten chilly all of a sudden, so I put on my yellow Montauk hoodie and adjusted the volume on my hearing aids and leaned against my backpack and started watching.
paras.cn: 电影立刻开始播放了。体育场的灯光暗了下来。修女玛利亚正站在山顶上，一圈又一圈地旋转。天气突然变冷了，所以我穿上我的黄色蒙托克连帽衫，调整了助听器的音量，靠在我的背包上，开始观看。

vocab.ex: When the fire alarm rang, we left the building right away.
The lights in the theater began to dim as the movie started.
The story was about a young woman who decided to become a nun.
The little girl loved to twirl in her new dress.
It's getting a bit chilly; I think I'll put on a sweater.
He wore a comfortable grey hoodie on the weekend.
You may need to adjust the settings on your camera.
He was tired, so he decided to lean against the wall for a moment.

gram.name: 用于“安顿下来”的连续动作
gram.pattern: Subject + Verb1, Verb2, Verb3, and Verb4.
gram.function: 通过一连串的简单过去时动词（'put on', 'adjusted', 'leaned', 'started watching'），作者描绘了主角为观看电影而安顿下来的一系列连贯动作。这种结构创造了一种平静、有序的感觉，与前文的喧闹形成对比。

example.en: She came home, took off her coat, made a cup of tea, and sat down to read.
example.cn: 她回到家，脱下外套，泡了一杯茶，然后坐下来读书。

gram.constraints: 是叙事中创建清晰时间线的基本技巧。

paras.en: The hills are alive . . .
paras.cn: 群山充满生机……

vocab.ex: After the rain, the garden seemed to come alive with color.

gram.name: 作为结尾的句子片段
gram.pattern: An incomplete sentence used for literary effect.
gram.function: 章节以一句来自电影《音乐之声》的著名歌词片段结尾。这个片段不仅确认了电影的开始，还起到了唤起情感和氛围的作用。它将读者的思绪直接带入电影的场景中，创造了一个充满诗意和期待感的开放式结尾。

example.en: He looked out at the city lights below. A new beginning...
example.cn: 他俯瞰着下方的城市灯火。一个新的开始……

gram.constraints: 是一种文学技巧，用于在章节结尾处留下持久的印象。

paras.en: Somewhere around the boring part where the guy named Rolf and the oldest daughter are singing You are sixteen, going on seventeen, Jack nudged me. "Dude, I've got to pee," he said. We both got up and kind of hopscotched over the kids who were sitting or lying down on the sleeping bags. Summer waved as we passed and I waved back.
paras.cn: 大概在那个叫罗尔夫的家伙和大女儿唱着《你十六岁，奔十七岁》的无聊部分，杰克用肘碰了我一下。“老兄，我得去小便，” 他说。我们俩都站了起来，有点像玩跳房子游戏一样，跳过那些或坐或躺在睡袋上的孩子们。我们经过时萨默挥了挥手，我也回挥了一下。

vocab.ex: She gave him a gentle nudge to wake him up.
I've got to finish this report by tomorrow.
The little boy said he needed to pee.
She had to hopscotch over the puddles to keep her shoes dry.

gram.name: 名词用作动词 (创造性用法)
gram.pattern: Using a noun that represents an action as a verb.
gram.function: 'hopscotched over the kids' 创造性地使用了儿童游戏的名字来描述一种特定的、小心翼翼的、跳跃式的移动。它比简单地说 'jumped over' 更具描述性和画面感。

example.en: He had to snake his way through the dense crowd to get to the front.
example.cn: 他必须像蛇一样蜿蜒穿过密集的人群才能到达前面。

gram.constraints: 是一种文学性的、非标准的动词用法，用于增强描述效果。

paras.en: There were lots of kids from the other schools walking around by the food trucks, playing the carnival games, or just hanging out. Of course, there was a huge line for the toilets. "Forget this, I'll just find a tree," said Jack. "That's gross, Jack. Let's just wait," I answered. But he headed off to the row of trees at the edge of the field, which was past the orange cones that we were specifically told not to go past. And of course I followed him. And of course we didn't have our flashlights because we forgot to bring them.
paras.cn: 有很多来自其他学校的孩子在餐车旁走来走去，玩着嘉年华游戏，或者只是闲逛。当然，厕所前排着一条长长的队。“算了吧，我就找棵树，” 杰克说。“那太恶心了，杰克。我们还是等等吧，” 我回答。但他却朝着场地边缘的那排树走去，那里已经超出了我们被明确告知不要越过的橙色圆锥筒。我当然也跟着他去了。我们当然也没带手电筒，因为我们忘了带。

vocab.ex: He won a stuffed animal at one of the carnival games.
A group of teenagers were hanging out at the shopping mall.
The instructions are too complicated. Forget this, I'll do it my own way.
There was a dead spider on the wall, it was so gross.
After breakfast, they headed off to the beach.
The instructions specifically said not to open the box.

gram.name: 重复 'And of course'
gram.pattern: Repetition of a phrase for ironic effect.
gram.function: 通过重复使用 'And of course'，叙述者创造了一种带有宿命感和讽刺意味的语气。它暗示了这些行为（跟着去、忘了带手电筒）虽然不明智，却是意料之中的，为即将发生的事件埋下了伏笔。

example.en: He decided to take a shortcut. And of course, he got lost. And of course, his phone was dead.
example.cn: 他决定走条近路。当然，他迷路了。当然，他的手机也没电了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过重复来增强叙事节奏和语气的技巧。

paras.en: It was so dark now we literally couldn't see ten steps ahead of us as we walked toward the woods. Luckily, the movie gave off some light, so when we saw a flashlight coming toward us out of the woods, we knew immediately that it was Henry, Miles, and Amos. I guess they hadn't wanted to wait on line to use the toilets, either.
paras.cn: 现在天那么黑，我们走向树林时，真的连前方十步都看不清。幸运的是，电影发出了一些光，所以当我们看到一个手电筒从树林里朝我们走来时，我们立刻就知道是亨利、迈尔斯和阿莫斯。我猜他们也不想排队上厕所。

vocab.mean: 简直；（用于加强语气的）真的
vocab.ex: It was so cold I literally felt my fingers turning to ice.
There's a long road ahead of us.
The flowers gave off a sweet scent.
He used a flashlight to see in the dark cave.

gram.name: so... that... 结果状语从句 (省略 that)
gram.pattern: so + adj + (that) + result clause
gram.function: 用于强调程度之深以至于产生了某种结果。'It was so dark... we literally couldn't see...' 强调了黑暗的程度及其后果。

example.en: The music was so loud we had to shout to each other.
example.cn: 音乐声太大了，我们都得对彼此大喊。

gram.constraints: 连词 'that' 在这种结构中常常被省略，尤其是在口语中。

paras.en: Miles and Henry were still not talking to Jack, but Amos had let go of the war a while ago. And he nodded hello to us as they passed by. "Be careful of the bears!" shouted Henry, and he and Miles laughed as they walked away. Amos shook his head at us like, Don't pay attention to them.
paras.cn: 迈尔斯和亨利仍然不和杰克说话，但阿莫斯不久前已经退出了那场战争。他们经过时，他对我们点了点头问好。“小心熊！” 亨利喊道，然后他和迈尔斯笑着走开了。阿莫斯对我们摇了摇头，好像在说：别理他们。

vocab.ex: It's time to let go of old grudges.
I saw him at the store a while ago.
A police car passed by with its sirens on.
Don't pay attention to his rude comments.

gram.name: 非语言交流（暗示言语）
gram.pattern: Action + 'like' + [implied dialogue].
gram.function: 描述一个非语言的姿态，然后使用 'like' 来明确说明该姿态所传达的信息。'Amos shook his head... like, Don't pay attention...' 将一个身体动作（摇头）翻译成其在特定情境下的确切含义（别理他们），让读者清晰地理解了角色间的互动。

example.en: She gave me a thumbs-up, like, 'You're doing great!'
example.cn: 她给了我一个大拇指，好像在说：‘你做得很好！’

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中解释非语言线索的有效技巧。

paras.en: Jack and I walked a little farther until we were just inside the woods. Then Jack hunted around for the perfect tree and finally did his business, though it felt like he was taking forever.
paras.cn: 我和杰克又走远了一点，直到我们刚好进入树林。然后杰克四处寻找一棵完美的树，最后解决了他的内急，不过感觉他花了很长时间。

vocab.ex: Let's walk a little farther down the beach.
I had to hunt around for my keys for ten minutes this morning.
The dog owner waited while his dog did its business on the grass.
This meeting is taking forever; I wish it would end.

gram.name: 委婉语
gram.pattern: Using an indirect phrase to refer to a sensitive topic.
gram.function: 'did his business' 是一个常见的、礼貌的委婉语，用来替代更直接的词语（如 'urinated'）。委婉语用于谈论可能令人不适或尴尬的话题。

example.en: Excuse me, I need to use the little boys' room.
example.cn: 不好意思，我需要去一下洗手间。

gram.constraints: 是社交语言中的一个重要方面。

paras.en: The woods were loud with strange sounds and chirps and croaks, like a wall of noise coming out of the trees. Then we started hearing loud snaps not far from us, almost like cap gun pops, that definitely weren't insect noises. And far away, like in another world, we could hear Raindrops on roses and whiskers on kittens.
paras.cn: 树林里充满了奇怪的声音、啾啾声和蛙鸣声，吵闹得像一堵从树丛里发出的噪音墙。然后我们开始听到离我们不远的地方传来响亮的啪嗒声，几乎像是玩具火药枪的爆破声，那绝对不是昆虫的声音。而在遥远的地方，仿佛在另一个世界，我们能听到“玫瑰上的雨滴和小猫的胡须”。

vocab.ex: I love waking up to the sound of birds chirping outside my window.
We could hear the croaks of frogs by the pond at night.

vocab.mean: 一堵噪音墙（比喻巨大的、压倒性的噪音）
vocab.ex: As the band came on stage, they were met with a wall of noise from the cheering crowd.
He broke the branch with a loud snap.
The children were playing cowboys with their new cap guns.

gram.name: 并置（用于营造不祥之兆）
gram.pattern: Placing two contrasting sounds or images side-by-side.
gram.function: 黑暗树林中未知、可能具有威胁性的声音（'loud snaps'）与远处电影中天真、快乐的歌曲（'Raindrops on roses...'）的并置，创造了一种令人不安的氛围。这种反差使得树林中的声音显得更加突兀和不祥，为即将发生的事件营造了悬念。

example.en: A child's innocent laughter was heard just before the sound of the explosion.
example.cn: 就在爆炸声响起前，听到了一个孩子天真的笑声。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来制造戏剧张力的有效技巧。

paras.en: "Ah, that's much better," said Jack, zipping up. "Now I have to pee," I said, which I did on the nearest tree. No way I was going farther in like Jack did. "Do you smell that? Like firecrackers," he said, coming over to me. "Oh yeah, that's what that is," I answered, zipping up. "Weird."
paras.cn: “啊，好多了，” 杰克说，拉上拉链。“现在我得小便了，” 我说，然后就在最近的树上解决了。我绝不可能像杰克那样走得更深。“你闻到那个味道了吗？像鞭炮，” 他朝我走来说。“哦是的，就是那个，” 我回答，拉上拉链。“怪怪的。”

vocab.ex: Could you help me zip up the back of my dress?
The cave was dark, and he was afraid to go farther in.
The sudden pop of a firecracker made the dog jump.
I heard a weird noise coming from the basement.

gram.name: 低调的结论性对话
gram.pattern: Ending a scene with a short, simple, and often inconclusive line of dialogue.
gram.function: 在一系列奇怪的声音和气味之后，章节并非以戏剧性事件结束，而是以一个简单的、低调的词 'Weird.' 结尾。这创造了悬念，让读者对这些奇怪的现象感到不安，并期待接下来会发生什么。

example.en: He looked at the empty box. 'Strange,' he whispered.
example.cn: 他看着空盒子。“奇怪，” 他低声说。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过留白来增强戏剧效果的技巧。

paras.en: We headed back the way we came, in the direction of the giant screen. That's when we walked straight into a group of kids we didn't know. They'd just come out of the woods, doing stuff I'm sure they didn't want their teachers to know about. I could smell the smoke now, the smell of both firecrackers and cigarettes. They pointed a flashlight at us. There were six of them: four boys and two girls. They looked like they were in the seventh grade.
paras.cn: 我们沿着来时的路往回走，朝着巨大屏幕的方向。就在那时，我们径直撞上了一群我们不认识的孩子。他们刚从树林里出来，做着我确定他们不想让老师知道的事。我现在能闻到烟味，既有鞭炮的味，也有香烟的味。他们用手电筒照着我们。他们有六个人：四个男孩和两个女孩。他们看起来像是七年级的学生。

vocab.ex: It's getting late; we should head back home.
He wasn't looking where he was going and walked straight into a lamppost.
The sudden pop of a firecracker made the dog jump.
He stepped outside to smoke a cigarette.

gram.name: 用感官细节进行铺垫
gram.pattern: Using sensory details (smell, sight) to hint at trouble.
gram.function: 通过一系列感官细节和暗示（“做着不想让老师知道的事”、“烟味”、“手电筒照着我们”），作者在冲突正式爆发前，有效地营造了一种不祥和具有威胁性的氛围。这些细节起到了铺垫（foreshadowing）的作用。

example.en: The sky grew dark, and a cold wind began to blow. He knew a storm was coming.
example.cn: 天色变暗，一阵冷风开始吹起。他知道暴风雨要来了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过环境描写来暗示情节发展的文学技巧。

paras.en: "What school are you from?" one of the boys called out. "Beecher Prep!" Jack started to answer, when all of a sudden one of the girls started screaming. "Oh my God!" she shrieked, holding her hand over her eyes like she was crying. I figured maybe a huge bug had just flown into her face or something. "No way!" one of the boys cried out, and he started flicking his hand in the air like he'd just touched something hot. And then he covered his mouth. "No freakin' way, man! No freakin' way!" All of them started half laughing and half covering their eyes now, pushing each other and cursing loudly.
paras.cn: “你们是哪个学校的？” 其中一个男孩喊道。“比彻预备学校！” 杰克刚要回答，突然一个女孩开始尖叫。“哦我的天！” 她尖叫着，用手捂住眼睛，好像在哭。我琢磨着可能是只大虫子刚飞到她脸上什么的。“不可能！” 其中一个男孩叫出声来，他开始在空中甩手，好像刚摸到了什么烫的东西。然后他捂住了嘴。“真他妈不可能，老兄！真他妈不可能！” 他们所有人都开始半笑半捂着眼睛，互相推搡着，大声咒骂。

vocab.ex: He had to call out her name twice before she heard him.
She shrieked when she saw the spider.
He flicked the dust off his jacket.
This is a freakin' amazing movie!
He started to curse loudly when he stubbed his toe.

gram.name: 戏剧性反讽
gram.pattern: The audience knows something a character does not.
gram.function: 读者已经知道主角的外貌与众不同，因此能立刻明白这群孩子的反应是针对主角的脸。然而，主角自己却天真地以为“可能是只大虫子飞到她脸上”。这种主角认知与读者认知之间的差距，即戏剧性反讽，创造了一种紧张和心酸的感觉。

example.en: In the movie, the audience knows the killer is hiding in the closet, but the character does not.
example.cn: 在电影中，观众知道杀手藏在衣柜里，但角色不知道。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的叙事技巧，用于增强读者的情感参与。

paras.en: "What is that?" said the kid who was pointing the flashlight at us, and it was only then that I realized that the flashlight was pointed right at my face, and what they were talking about—screaming about—was me. "Let's get out of here," Jack said to me quietly, and he pulled me by my sweatshirt sleeve and started walking away from them. "Wait wait wait!" yelled the guy with the flashlight, cutting us off. He pointed the flashlight right in my face again, and now he was only about five feet away. "Oh man! Oh man!!" he said, shaking his head, his mouth wide open. "What happened to your face?"
paras.cn: “那是什么？” 那个用手电筒照着我们的孩子说，直到那时我才意识到手电筒正对着我的脸，而他们谈论的——尖叫的——是我。“我们离开这里，” 杰克轻声对我说，他拉着我的卫衣袖子，开始离开他们。“等等等等！” 拿手电筒的家伙喊道，拦住了我们的去路。他又把手电筒直对着我的脸，现在他离我们只有大约五英尺远。“哦天哪！哦天哪！！” 他说，摇着头，嘴巴张得大大的。“你的脸怎么了？”

vocab.ex: It was only then that I understood the true meaning of his words.
He wore a comfortable grey sweatshirt on the weekend.

vocab.mean: 拦住某人的去路；打断某人说话
vocab.ex: A car suddenly cut me off on the highway.
His eyes were wide open with surprise.

gram.name: 强调句型 (It was only then that...)
gram.pattern: It was only + [time phrase] + that + [clause].
gram.function: 用于强调某个事件发生的确切时间点，通常指一个迟来的顿悟或发现。'it was only then that I realized...' 强调了主角直到那一刻才明白过来自己是骚乱的中心。

example.en: It was only after he left that I found the letter.
example.cn: 直到他离开后我才发现那封信。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常强力的强调时间点的句型。

paras.en: "Stop it, Eddie," said one of the girls. "I didn't know we were watching Lord of the Rings tonight!" he said. "Look, guys, it's Gollum!" This made his friends hysterical. Again we tried to walk away from them, and again the kid named Eddie cut us off. He was at least a head taller than Jack, who was about a head taller than me, so the guy looked huge to me. "No man, it's Alien !" said one of the other kids. "No, no, no, man. It's an orc!" laughed Eddie, pointing the flashlight in my face again. This time he was right in front of us.
paras.cn: “别这样，埃迪，” 其中一个女孩说。“我不知道我们今晚在看《指环王》！” 他说。“看，伙计们，是咕噜！” 这让他的朋友们笑得歇斯底里。我们又一次试图离开他们，又一次那个叫埃迪的孩子拦住了我们。他至少比杰克高一个头，而杰克又比我高一个头，所以这家伙在我看来巨大无比。“不，老兄，是异形！” 另一个孩子说。“不，不，不，老兄。是个兽人！” 埃迪笑着，又把手电筒对准我的脸。这次他就在我们正前方。

vocab.ex: The character Gollum is known for his strange appearance and voice.

vocab.mean: 歇斯底里地（大笑或大哭）
vocab.ex: The joke was so funny that everyone became hysterical with laughter.
His older brother is a head taller than him.
They live in a huge house with ten bedrooms.
The movie 'Alien' features a terrifying extraterrestrial creature.
In the story, the heroes had to fight an army of orcs.

gram.name: 用典故进行侮辱
gram.pattern: Comparing someone to a monstrous or negative character.
gram.function: 欺凌者通过引用流行文化中著名的、外貌奇特或可怕的角色（'Gollum', 'Alien', 'orc'）来比喻主角，这是一种残酷的、非直接的侮辱方式。它通过共同的文化背景，向同伴传达了对主角外貌的嘲弄。

example.en: He called the strict teacher 'Voldemort'.
example.cn: 他称那位严格的老师为“伏地魔”。

gram.constraints: 其侮辱性依赖于被引用角色的负面含义。

paras.en: "Leave him alone, okay?" said Jack, pushing the hand holding the flashlight away. "Make me," answered Eddie, pointing the flashlight in Jack's face now. "What's your problem, dude?" said Jack. "Your boyfriend's my problem!" "Jack, let's just go," I said, pulling him by the arm. "Oh man, it talks!" screamed Eddie, shining the flashlight in my face again. Then one of the other guys threw a firecracker at our feet.
paras.cn: “别烦他，好吗？” 杰克说，推开了那只拿着手电筒的手。“你让我试试，” 埃迪回答，现在把手电筒对准了杰克的脸。“你有什么毛病，老兄？” 杰克说。“你男朋友就是我的毛病！” “杰克，我们走吧，” 我说，拉着他的胳膊。“哦天哪，它会说话！” 埃迪尖叫着，又把手电筒照在我脸上。然后另一个家伙朝我们脚下扔了一个鞭炮。

vocab.ex: Please just leave me alone; I need some quiet time.
"Stop talking!" "Make me."
Why are you being so rude? What's your problem?

vocab.mean: 它会说话！（用于非人化和侮辱）
vocab.ex: The bullies were surprised the quiet kid spoke up, saying cruelly, 'Look, it talks!'

gram.name: 用 'it' 进行非人化
gram.pattern: Referring to a person as 'it'.
gram.function: 在英语中，用代词 'it' 来指代一个人是一种极端的非人化（dehumanization）和侮辱。当埃迪喊出 'it talks!' 时，他将主角物化，剥夺了他的基本人性，这是言语欺凌的一种严重形式。

example.en: Don't refer to the new student as 'it'; she has a name.
example.cn: 不要用‘它’来指代新同学，她有名字的。

gram.constraints: 是一种极具攻击性和侮辱性的语言用法。

paras.en: Jack tried to push past Eddie, but Eddie shoved his hands into Jack's shoulders and pushed him hard, which made Jack fall backward. "Eddie!" screamed one of the girls. "Look," I said, stepping in front of Jack and holding my hands up in the air like a traffic cop. "We're a lot smaller than you guys . . ." "Are you talking to me, Freddie Krueger? I don't think you want to mess with me, you ugly freak," said Eddie. And this was the point where I knew I should run away as fast as I could, but Jack was still on the ground and I wasn't about to leave him.
paras.cn: 杰克试图推开埃迪，但埃迪用双手猛推杰克的肩膀，把他狠狠地推倒了，杰克向后摔倒在地。“埃迪！” 其中一个女孩尖叫道。“听着，” 我说，挡在杰克前面，双手举在空中，像个交通警察。“我们比你们小得多……” “你在跟我说话吗，弗莱迪·克鲁格？我想你不想惹我，你这个丑八怪，” 埃迪说。就在这时，我知道我应该尽快跑开，但杰克还在地上，我不会抛下他。

vocab.ex: He shoved me out of the way to get to the front of the line.
He lost his balance and fell backward down the stairs.
The traffic cop was directing cars through the busy intersection.

vocab.mean: 弗莱迪·克鲁格（恐怖电影角色）
vocab.ex: The villain Freddie Krueger is known for his scarred face and bladed glove.
He's a dangerous guy; you don't want to mess with him.
I'm tired, but I'm not about to give up on the race now.

gram.name: This was the point where...
gram.pattern: This was the point where + clause.
gram.function: 用于在叙事中标记一个关键的转折点或决策时刻。'...this was the point where I knew I should run away...' 清楚地指出了主角意识到危险并面临“战斗或逃跑”选择的关键时刻。

example.en: This was the point where the hero had to make his most difficult choice.
example.cn: 这就是英雄必须做出他最艰难选择的时刻。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中强调关键时刻的常用技巧。

paras.en: "Yo, dude," said a new voice behind us. "What's up, man?" Eddie spun around and pointed his flashlight toward the voice. For a second, I couldn't believe who it was. "Leave them alone, dude," said Amos, with Miles and Henry right behind him. "Says who?" said one of the guys with Eddie. "Just leave them alone, dude," Amos repeated calmly. "Are you a freak, too?" said Eddie. "They're all a bunch of freaks!" said one of his friends. Amos didn't answer them but looked at us. "Come on, guys, let's go. Mr. Tushman's waiting for us."
paras.cn: “哟，哥们，” 我们身后传来一个新声音。“怎么了，老兄？” 埃迪转过身，用手电筒照向那个声音。有一瞬间，我简直不敢相信那是谁。“别烦他们，哥们，” 阿莫斯说，迈尔斯和亨利就跟在他身后。“谁说的？” 埃迪的一个同伙说。“别烦他们就行了，哥们，” 阿莫斯平静地重复道。“你也是个怪物吗？” 埃迪说。“他们都是一群怪物！” 他的一个朋友说。阿莫斯没有回答他们，而是看着我们。“走吧，伙计们。塔什曼先生在等我们。”

vocab.mean: （俚语）哟（用于打招呼或引起注意）
vocab.ex: Yo, what time are we meeting tonight?
She spun around when she heard her name called.
"You can't park here." "Says who?"
A bunch of kids were playing in the park.

gram.name: 解围之神（救援者到来）
gram.pattern: A sudden and unexpected intervention that resolves a hopeless situation.
gram.function: 在主角和杰克处于绝望、无助的境地时，之前与他们有过节的Amos, Miles和Henry的突然出现，并站在他们一边，构成了一个经典的“解围之神”（Deus Ex Machina）情节。这个意想不到的转折不仅解决了眼前的危机，也标志着角色关系的重要转变。

example.en: The hero was trapped, but suddenly, his long-lost brother appeared and saved him.
example.cn: 英雄被困住了，但突然，他失散多年的兄弟出现并救了他。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中用于解决看似无解困境的文学手法。

paras.en: I knew that was a lie, but I helped Jack get up, and we started walking over to Amos. Then out of the blue, the Eddie guy grabbed my hood as I passed by him, yanking it really hard so I was pulled backward and fell flat on my back. It was a hard fall, and I hurt my elbow pretty bad on a rock. I couldn't really see what happened afterward, except that Amos rammed into the Eddie guy like a monster truck and they both fell down to the ground next to me.
paras.cn: 我知道那是个谎言，但我还是扶起杰克，我们开始向阿莫斯走去。然后出乎意料地，那个叫埃迪的家伙在我经过他时抓住了我的兜帽，狠狠地一拽，我被向后拉倒，仰面摔倒在地。摔得很重，我的手肘在一块石头上磕得很厉害。我没能真正看清之后发生了什么，只知道阿莫斯像一辆怪物卡车一样撞向那个叫埃迪的家伙，然后他们俩都倒在了我旁边的地上。

vocab.ex: I hadn't heard from him in years, then he called me out of the blue.
She yanked the door open and ran outside.
He slipped on the ice and fell flat on his back.
The car lost control and rammed into a tree.
We went to a show to watch giant monster trucks crush smaller cars.

gram.name: 用于描述猛烈动作的明喻
gram.pattern: ... like a [powerful object].
gram.function: 通过将Amos的撞击比作 'a monster truck'，作者使用了一个强有力的明喻来生动地传达这个动作的巨大力量、速度和冲击力。这个比喻有效地描绘了Amos保护朋友的决心和行动的果断。

example.en: He hit the punching bag like a battering ram.
example.cn: 他像攻城槌一样击打着沙袋。

gram.constraints: 比喻的有效性取决于其与被比喻事物的相似性。

paras.en: Everything got really crazy after that. Someone pulled me up by my sleeve and yelled, "Run!" and someone else screamed, "Get 'em!" at the same time, and for a few seconds I actually had two people pulling the sleeves of my sweatshirt in opposite directions. I heard them both cursing, until my sweatshirt ripped and the first guy yanked me by my arm and started pulling me behind him as we ran, which I did as fast as I could. I could hear footsteps just behind us, chasing us, and voices shouting and girls screaming, but it was so dark I didn't know whose voices they were, only that everything felt like we were underwater. We were running like crazy, and it was pitch black, and whenever I started to slow down, the guy pulling me by my arm would yell, "Don't stop!"
paras.cn: 那之后一切都变得非常疯狂。有人拉着我的袖子把我拉起来，喊道：“跑！” 同时另一个人尖叫道：“抓住他们！” 有那么几秒钟，我居然被两个人拉着卫衣的袖子朝相反的方向扯。我听到他们俩都在咒骂，直到我的卫衣被撕裂，第一个家伙猛地抓住我的胳膊，开始拉着我跟在他后面跑，我也尽我所能地快跑。我能听到我们身后紧跟着的脚步声，追赶着我们，还有喊叫声和女孩们的尖叫声，但天太黑了，我不知道那些是谁的声音，只感觉一切都像在水下一样。我们像疯了一样地跑，周围一片漆黑，每当我开始慢下来，那个拉着我胳膊的家伙就会喊：“别停！”

vocab.ex: The party started to get crazy after midnight.
"There they are! Get 'em!" shouted the police officer.
He ripped his shirt while climbing over the fence.
When they saw the bear, they started to run like crazy.
We couldn't see anything in the pitch black cave.

gram.name: 感官剥夺的明喻
gram.pattern: ... felt like we were underwater.
gram.function: 在混乱、黑暗和充满各种声音的场景中，使用“像在水下一样”（like we were underwater）的比喻，生动地传达了一种感官扭曲、声音沉闷、行动迟缓的混乱感觉。这是一个非常有效的比喻，用来描绘恐慌和肾上腺素飙升时的生理和心理体验。

example.en: During the explosion, everything seemed to move in slow motion, and all sounds felt like they were coming from underwater.
example.cn: 爆炸期间，一切似乎都以慢动作移动，所有声音都感觉像是从水下传来。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过比喻来描绘极端感官体验的高级技巧。

paras.en: Finally, after what seemed like a forever of running, someone yelled: "I think we lost them!" "Amos?" "I'm right here!" said Amos's voice a few feet behind us. "We can stop!" Miles yelled from farther up. "Jack!" I yelled. "Whoa!" said Jack. "I'm here." "I can't see a thing!" "Are you sure we lost them?" Henry asked, letting go of my arm. That's when I realized that he'd been the one who was pulling me as we ran.
paras.cn: 终于，在跑了仿佛一辈子之后，有人喊道：“我想我们甩掉他们了！” “阿莫斯？” “我在这里！” 阿莫斯的声音在我们身后几英尺处传来。“我们可以停了！” 迈尔斯从更前面喊道。“杰克！” 我喊道。“哇！” 杰克说。“我在这儿。” “我什么也看不见！” “你确定我们甩掉他们了吗？” 亨利问，松开了我的胳膊。就在那时我才意识到，跑的时候一直是他在拉着我。

vocab.ex: We waited for what seemed like an eternity for the bus to arrive.
The spy drove through the narrow streets, trying to lose the car that was following him.
Without my glasses, I can't see a thing.
He refused to let go of the rope.

gram.name: 用于表现迷失方向的碎片化对话
gram.pattern: A series of short, overlapping lines of dialogue.
gram.function: 通过一连串简短、快速、甚至重叠的对话（“Amos?”、“I'm right here!”、“Jack!”、“I'm here.”），作者生动地营造了一种在黑暗中混乱、迷失方向的感觉。角色们通过声音来确认彼此的位置，让读者能真切地感受到当时的紧张和不确定性。

example.en: "Hello?" she called into the dark cave. "Is anyone there?" "Here!" a voice echoed back.
example.cn: “喂？” 她对着漆黑的洞穴喊道。“有人在吗？”“这里！”一个声音回响着。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中营造混乱或紧张气氛的有效技巧。

paras.en: We all got super quiet, listening for footsteps in the dark. All we could hear were the crickets and frogs and our own crazy panting. We were out of breath, stomachs hurting, bodies bent over our knees.
paras.cn: 我们都变得超级安静，在黑暗中留心听着脚步声。我们所能听到的只有蟋蟀和青蛙的叫声，以及我们自己疯狂的喘息声。我们上气不接下气，肚子疼，身体弯着撑在膝盖上。

vocab.ex: After the children went to bed, the house was super quiet.
The sound of crickets filled the warm summer night.
After the long run, his heavy panting was the only sound in the room.
He was out of breath after climbing the five flights of stairs.

gram.name: 用于营造氛围的感官细节
gram.pattern: Using auditory and physical sensations to create a scene.
gram.function: 作者通过听觉细节（'crickets and frogs', 'crazy panting'）和身体感觉的描述（'out of breath, stomachs hurting, bodies bent over'），生动地描绘了逃跑后的场景，不仅营造了夜晚树林的氛围，还传达了角色们身体上的极度疲惫和紧张后的余悸。

example.en: The smell of rain, the cool breeze on his face, the distant rumble of thunder—he knew a storm was near.
example.cn: 雨的气味，脸上凉爽的微风，远处隆隆的雷声——他知道一场暴风雨就要来了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过具体感官体验来让读者身临其境的写作技巧。

paras.en: "We lost them," said Henry. "Whoa! That was intense!" "What happened to the flashlight?" "I dropped it!" "How did you guys know?" said Jack. "We saw them before." "They looked like jerks." "You just rammed into him!" I said to Amos. "I know, right?" laughed Amos. "He didn't even see it coming!" said Miles. "He was like, 'Are you a freak, too?' and you were like, bam! " said Jack. "Bam!" said Amos, throwing a fake punch in the air. "But after I tackled him, I was like, run, Amos, you schmuck, he's ten times bigger than you! And I got up and started running as fast as I could!"
paras.cn: “我们甩掉他们了，” 亨利说。“哇！那太激烈了！” “手电筒怎么了？” “我掉了！” “你们怎么知道的？” 杰克说。“我们之前看到他们了。” “他们看起来像混蛋。” “你刚才简直是直接撞向他！” 我对阿莫斯说。“我知道，是吧？” 阿莫斯笑道。“他甚至没料到会这样！” 迈尔斯说。“他当时说：‘你也是个怪物吗？’然后你就，‘砰！’” 杰克说。“砰！” 阿莫斯说，在空中打出一记假拳。“但在我扑倒他之后，我心里想的是，跑，阿莫斯，你这个笨蛋，他比你大十倍！然后我就爬起来，尽我所能地快跑！”

vocab.ex: The final minutes of the game were incredibly intense.
Don't be such a jerk to your little sister.
The car lost control and rammed into a tree.
The surprise attack was so sudden, they didn't see it coming.
He pushed the door, and bam! It flew open.
The police officer had to tackle the suspect to the ground.
He felt like a schmuck for believing the ridiculous story.

gram.name: 对话中的拟声词
gram.pattern: Using a sound word to describe an action.
gram.function: 在复述打斗场面时，角色们使用了拟声词 'bam!' 来模仿撞击的声音。这种用法比单纯描述“他撞到了他”更生动、更有力，充满了青少年对话的活力和画面感。

example.en: The glass fell off the table and smash! It broke into a thousand pieces.
example.cn: 玻璃杯从桌上掉下来，“啪”的一声！碎成了一千片。

gram.constraints: 是一种在非正式叙事中非常有效的技巧。

paras.en: "Where the heck are we?" asked Amos. "I can't even see the screen." "I think we're in the cornfields," answered Henry. "Duh, we're in the cornfields," said Miles, pushing a cornstalk at Henry.
paras.cn: “我们到底在哪儿？” 阿莫斯问。“我连屏幕都看不见。” “我想我们在玉米地里，” 亨利回答。“废话，我们当然在玉米地里，” 迈尔斯说，用一根玉米秆推了推亨利。

vocab.ex: I've been looking for my keys for an hour. Where the heck are they?
The children got lost playing hide-and-seek in the vast cornfield.

vocab.mean: （非正式，表示对方说了显而易见的事）废话
vocab.ex: A: "Is water wet?" B: "Duh!"
The scarecrow was made of old clothes and cornstalks.

gram.name: 建立角色动态
gram.pattern: Dialogue and actions that reveal relationships.
gram.function: 通过简短的对话和动作，作者清晰地展现了这群男孩之间的动态。Henry提出了一个不确定的观察，而Miles用一个不屑的 'Duh' 和一个肢体动作（推玉米秆）来回应。这表明Miles在这个小团体中可能扮演着一个更强势、更爱嘲弄的角色。

example.en: When she made a suggestion, he immediately dismissed it. It showed who was in charge.
example.cn: 当她提出建议时，他立刻就否决了。这显示了谁是主导者。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过细微互动来塑造人物和关系的写作技巧。

paras.en: "Okay, I know exactly where we are," said Amos. "We have to go back in this direction. That'll take us to the other side of the field." "Yo, dudes," said Jack, hand high in the air. "That was really cool of you guys to come back for us. Really cool. Thanks." "No problem," answered Amos, high-fiving Jack. And then Miles and Henry high-fived him, too.
paras.cn: “好了，我确切地知道我们在哪里了，” 阿莫斯说。“我们得朝这个方向回去。那会带我们到场地的另一边。” “哟，哥们儿们，” 杰克说，手高高举在空中。“你们回来帮我们，真的太酷了。真的很酷。谢谢。” “没问题，” 阿莫斯回答，和杰克击了个掌。然后迈尔斯和亨利也和他击了掌。

vocab.ex: The map says we need to walk in this direction for another mile.
"Yo, dudes, check out this cool trick!" he said to his friends.
It was very cool of you to stand up for him.
He forgot his wallet, so he had to come back for it.
"Thanks for your help!" "No problem!"
After they won the game, the teammates started high-fiving each other.

gram.name: 和解与结盟的仪式
gram.pattern: A formal expression of gratitude followed by a physical gesture of unity.
gram.function: 杰克正式的感谢和随后所有人的相互击掌，不仅仅是一个简单的道谢。在这个情境下，它成为了一种仪式，标志着之前的“战争”的结束，以及一个新的、更广泛的同盟的形成。这个身体姿态（击掌）具体化了这种新建立的团结。

example.en: After the argument, he extended his hand. "Friends?" he asked. They shook on it.
example.cn: 争吵过后，他伸出手。“还是朋友吗？” 他问。他们握手言和。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过象征性行为来展示关系转变的叙事技巧。

paras.en: "Yeah, dudes, thanks," I said, holding my palm up like Jack just had, though I wasn't sure if they'd high-five me, too. Amos looked at me and nodded. "It was cool how you stood your ground, little dude," he said, high-fiving me. "Yeah, Auggie," said Miles, high-fiving me, too. "You were like, 'We're littler than you guys' . . ." "I didn't know what else to say!" I laughed. "Very cool," said Henry, and he high-fived me, too.
paras.cn: “是啊，哥们儿们，谢谢，” 我说，像杰克刚才那样举起我的手掌，尽管我不确定他们是否也会和我击掌。阿莫斯看着我，点了点头。“你坚守阵地的样子很酷，小哥们，” 他说，和我击了个掌。“是的，奥吉，” 迈尔斯说，也和我击了个掌。“你当时说：‘我们比你们小得多’……” “我不知道还能说什么！” 我笑了。“非常酷，” 亨利说，他也和我击了掌。

vocab.ex: He held the small bird gently in the palm of his hand.
Despite the pressure, she stood her ground and refused to change her mind.
The surfer called out to the young boy, 'Hey, little dude, nice wave!'

gram.name: 包容的行为
gram.pattern: A hesitant gesture met with positive reinforcement.
gram.function: 主角模仿杰克的行为（举起手掌），但内心充满不确定（'I wasn't sure if they'd high-five me'）。Amos、Miles和Henry随后不仅与他击掌，还 verbalize（用言语表达）了对他的认可（'It was cool how you stood your ground'）。这个过程——从犹豫的模仿到被完全接纳——是一个强大的、标志着主角被这个团体真正包容的时刻。

example.en: Timidly, she raised her hand to ask a question, and the teacher smiled encouragingly.
example.cn: 她胆怯地举手提问，老师则报以鼓励的微笑。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过具体互动来展示角色关系发展的技巧。

paras.en: "Sorry I ripped your sweatshirt." I looked down, and my sweatshirt was completely torn down the middle. One sleeve was ripped off, and the other was so stretched out it was hanging down to my knees. "Hey, your elbow's bleeding," said Jack. "Yeah." I shrugged. It was starting to hurt a lot. "You okay?" said Jack, seeing my face. I nodded. Suddenly I felt like crying, and I was trying really hard not to do that.
paras.cn: “对不起，我扯坏了你的卫衣。” 我低头一看，我的卫衣中间完全裂开了。一只袖子被扯掉了，另一只被拉得那么长，都垂到我的膝盖了。“嘿，你的手肘在流血，” 杰克说。“是的。” 我耸了耸肩。它开始变得很疼。“你还好吗？” 杰克看着我的脸说。我点了点头。突然，我想哭了，我非常努力地不让自己哭出来。

vocab.ex: He ripped his shirt while climbing over the fence.
He was wearing a pair of old, torn jeans.
My favorite sweater got stretched out in the wash.
He rested his elbow on the table.
He cut his finger and it started to bleed.

gram.name: 延迟的情感反应
gram.pattern: Shift from physical assessment to emotional response.
gram.function: 在紧张事件结束后，角色的注意力首先集中在外部的、物理性的损伤上（卫衣、手肘）。直到朋友表现出关心（'You okay?'），肾上腺素褪去，延迟的情感反应才涌现出来（'Suddenly I felt like crying'）。这真实地描绘了创伤后的心理过程。

example.en: After the car crash, he first checked for injuries. Only later did he start to shake.
example.cn: 车祸后，他首先检查了伤势。直到后来他才开始发抖。

gram.constraints: 是一种现实地描绘角色在危机后反应的叙事技巧。
