paras.en: "Wait, your hearing aids are gone!" said Jack. "What!" I yelled, touching my ears. The hearing aid band was definitely gone. That's why I felt like I was underwater! "Oh no!" I said, and that's when I couldn't hold it in anymore. Everything that had just happened kind of hit me and I couldn't help it: I started to cry. Like big crying, what Mom would call "the waterworks." I was so embarrassed I hid my face in my arm, but I couldn't stop the tears from coming.
paras.cn: “等等，你的助听器不见了！” 杰克说。“什么！” 我喊道，摸着我的耳朵。助听器头带确实不见了。这就是为什么我感觉像在水下一样！“哦不！” 我说，就在那时我再也忍不住了。刚才发生的一切都有点冲击到我，我控制不住自己：我开始哭了。是大哭，就是妈妈会称之为“开闸放水”的那种。我太尴尬了，把脸埋在胳膊里，但眼泪就是止不住地流。

vocab.ex: I can't find my keys; they're completely gone.
The divers were exploring the shipwreck underwater.
She tried to hold it in, but she couldn't stop the tears.
The reality of the situation finally hit him.
When she heard the sad news, she turned on the waterworks.
He was embarrassed when he forgot her name.

gram.name: 认知（顿悟时刻）
gram.pattern: A sudden realization that explains a previous feeling.
gram.function: 主角之前描述了一种奇怪的感觉（'like I was underwater'）。直到杰克指出助听器不见了，他才恍然大悟。这个“顿悟时刻”（在文学上称为 Anagnorisis），'That's why I felt like I was underwater!'，将一个模糊的感官体验与一个具体的物理事实联系起来，并成为压垮他的最后一根稻草，引发了情绪的彻底崩溃。

example.en: He had been feeling tired for weeks. When the doctor gave him the diagnosis, he finally understood. 'So that's why,' he thought.
example.cn: 他已经感觉疲惫了好几周。当医生给他诊断结果时，他终于明白了。‘原来是这样，’ 他想。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中创造“啊哈！”时刻的有效技巧。

paras.en: The guys were really nice to me, though. They patted me on the back. "You're okay, dude. It's okay," they said. "You're one brave little dude, you know that?" said Amos, putting his arm around my shoulders. And when I kept on crying, he put both his arms around me like my dad would have done and let me cry.
paras.cn: 不过，那些家伙对我真的很好。他们拍了拍我的背。“你没事的，哥们。没事的，” 他们说。“你是个勇敢的小家伙，你知道吗？” 阿莫斯说，把胳膊搭在我的肩膀上。当我继续哭的时候，他用双臂抱住我，就像我爸爸会做的那样，让我尽情地哭。

vocab.mean: 拍某人的背（表示安慰或鼓励）
vocab.ex: The coach patted the player on the back after he missed the shot.
It was brave of you to speak up like that.
He put his arm around his friend to comfort her.
Sometimes the best thing you can do for a friend is just sit with them and let them cry.

gram.name: 用于描述同情行为的明喻
gram.pattern: ... like [a caring person] would have done.
gram.function: 通过将Amos的安慰行为与一个充满爱和安全的基准（'like my dad would have done'）进行比较，作者深刻地传达了这个拥抱的意义。它不仅仅是一个身体姿态，更是一种父亲般的、充满保护和同情的行为，标志着这些男孩之间关系的彻底转变，从欺凌者和旁观者变成了保护者。

example.en: She listened to my problems with a patience like a saint would have had.
example.cn: 她听我倾诉问题时，展现出了圣人般的耐心。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过比喻来赋予行为深层情感意义的技巧。

paras.en: We backtracked through the grass for a good ten minutes to see if we could find my hearing aids, but it was way too dark to see anything. We literally had to hold on to each other's shirts and walk in single file so we wouldn't trip over one another. It was like black ink had been poured all around. "This is hopeless," said Henry. "They could be anywhere." "Maybe we can come back with a flashlight," answered Amos. "No, it's okay," I said. "Let's just go back. Thanks, though."
paras.cn: 我们沿着草地原路返回了大约十分钟，看看是否能找到我的助听器，但天太黑了，什么也看不见。我们真的得互相抓着对方的衬衫，排成单行走路，才不会被彼此绊倒。感觉就像周围被泼满了黑色的墨水。“这没希望了，” 亨利说。“它们可能在任何地方。” “也许我们可以带个手电筒回来，” 阿莫斯回答。“不，没关系了，” 我说。“我们回去吧。不过还是谢谢了。”

vocab.ex: After realizing he took a wrong turn, he had to backtrack a mile.
This soup is way too salty to eat.
The students walked in single file down the narrow hallway.
Be careful not to trip over the toy car on the floor.
After searching for hours, the situation felt hopeless.

gram.name: 用于描述感官剥夺的明喻
gram.pattern: like + [sensory description]
gram.function: 通过一个强烈的、具体的视觉形象（'black ink had been poured all around'），来比喻完全的黑暗。这个明喻有效地传达了主角在黑暗中失去视觉的体验，创造了一种被包裹、迷失方向的感觉。

example.en: The sudden noise was like a physical blow, stunning him into silence.
example.cn: 那突如其来的噪音就像一记重击，让他震惊得说不出话来。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过比喻来描绘极端感官体验的技巧。

paras.en: We walked back toward the cornfields, and then cut through them until the back of the giant screen came into view. Since it was facing away from us, we didn't get any light from the screen at all until we'd walked around to the edge of the woods again. That's where we finally started seeing a little light. There was no sign of the seventh graders anywhere. "Where do you think they went?" said Jack. "Back to the food trucks," said Amos. "They're probably thinking we're going to report them." "Are we?" asked Henry. They looked at me. I shook my head. "Okay," said Amos, "but, little dude, don't walk around here alone again, okay? If you need to go somewhere, tell us and we'll go with you." "Okay." I nodded.
paras.cn: 我们走回玉米地的方向，然后穿过玉米地，直到巨大屏幕的背面映入眼帘。由于屏幕背对着我们，我们一点光也得不到，直到我们再次走到树林的边缘。在那里我们终于开始看到一点光亮。那群七年级学生不见踪影。“你觉得他们去哪了？” 杰克说。“回餐车那边了，” 阿莫斯说。“他们可能以为我们要去告发他们。” “我们要吗？” 亨利问。他们看着我。我摇了摇头。“好吧，” 阿莫斯说，“但是，小哥们，以后别再一个人在这里走动了，好吗？如果你需要去什么地方，告诉我们，我们陪你去。” “好的。” 我点了点头。

vocab.ex: Let's cut through the park; it's a shortcut.
As we climbed the hill, the entire city came into view.
She was facing away from the camera, so I couldn't see her expression.
We searched for hours, but there was no sign of the lost cat.
You should report the crime to the police immediately.

gram.name: 提供保护与建立同盟
gram.pattern: A direct command/request offering group support.
gram.function: Amos的话语（'don't walk around here alone again', 'we'll go with you'）标志着一个重要的关系转变。它不再是关于之前的冲突，而是主动地提供保护和团体支持。这个行为将之前的对立或中立关系，转变为一个新的、保护性的同盟。

example.en: You shouldn't have to deal with this by yourself. From now on, let us help you.
example.cn: 你不应该独自处理这件事。从现在起，让我们来帮你。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过言语来重塑角色关系和动态的有效方式。

paras.en: As we got closer to the screen, I could hear High on a hill was a lonely goatherd, and could smell the cotton candy from one of the concession stands near the food trucks. There were lots of kids milling around in this area, so I pulled what was left of my hoodie over my head and kept my face down, hands in pockets, as we made our way through the crowd. It had been a long time since I'd been out without my hearing aids, and it felt like I was miles under the earth. It felt like that song Miranda used to sing to me: Ground Control to Major Tom, your circuit's dead, there's something wrong . . . I did notice as I walked that Amos had stayed right next to me. And Jack was close on the other side of me. And Miles was in front of us and Henry was in back of us. They were surrounding me as we walked through the crowds of kids. Like I had my own emperor's guard.
paras.cn: 当我们走近屏幕时，我能听到“山顶上有一个孤独的牧羊人”，也能闻到餐车附近小吃摊的棉花糖味。这个区域有很多孩子在闲逛，所以我把我连帽衫剩下的部分拉起来罩住头，低着头，手插在口袋里，穿过人群。我已经很久没有不戴助听器出门了，感觉就像我在地下几英里深处。感觉就像米兰达以前唱给我听的那首歌：“地面指挥中心呼叫汤姆少校，你的电路坏了，出问题了……” 我确实注意到，我走路时阿莫斯一直紧挨着我。杰克在我另一边也很近。迈尔斯在我们前面，亨利在我们后面。当我们穿过成群的孩子时，他们正包围着我。就像我有了自己的皇帝卫队一样。

vocab.ex: The old goatherd led his flock through the mountains.
We bought popcorn and soda from the concession stand.
A crowd of people were milling around the entrance, waiting for the doors to open.
He ate what was left of the cake from yesterday.
An electrician is coming to fix the faulty circuit.
The police surrounded the building where the suspect was hiding.
The emperor's guard was known for its loyalty and skill in combat.

gram.name: 用于描述保护的高潮式明喻
gram.pattern: Like + [powerful protective image].
gram.function: 作为章节的结尾，这个明喻（'Like I had my own emperor's guard'）提供了一个强大而充满情感的结论。它将一群普通的男孩转变为一支高贵、忠诚的保护性单位，将一个简单的友谊行为提升到了一个更具象征意义和电影感的层面，与主角之前的孤立感形成了强烈的对比。

example.en: The nurses stood by his bed all night, like a tireless honor guard.
example.cn: 护士们整夜守在他的床边，就像一支不知疲倦的仪仗队。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过比喻来赋予行为深层情感意义的技巧。

paras.en: Then they came out of the narrow valley and at once she saw the reason. There stood Peter and Edmund and all the rest of Aslan's army fighting desperately against the crowd of horrible creatures whom she had seen last night; only now, in the daylight, they looked even stranger and more evil and more deformed.
paras.cn: 然后他们走出了狭窄的山谷，她立刻就明白了原因。彼得和埃德蒙以及所有阿斯兰的军队都在那里，正拼命地对抗着她昨晚见过的那群可怕的生物；只是现在，在日光下，它们看起来更奇怪、更邪恶、更畸形了。

vocab.ex: When the bell rang, all the students stood up at once.
He was desperately trying to stay afloat in the rough water.
The movie featured a strange creature from another planet.
The accident left his hand permanently deformed.

gram.name: 卷首引文
gram.pattern: A quotation at the beginning of a chapter.
gram.function: 使用另一部文学作品（《纳尼亚传奇》）的引文作为章节的开头，这被称为卷首引文（epigraph）。这段引文关于在日光下看清邪恶的描述，为本章的主题——主角在事后清晰地反思和理解前一晚的创伤——设定了基调。

example.en: The book began with an epigraph from Shakespeare.
example.cn: 这本书以一段莎士比亚的引文开篇。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过引用来预示主题或氛围的文学技巧。

paras.en: I stopped there. I'd been reading for over an hour and sleep still didn't come. It was almost two a.m. Everyone else was asleep. I had my flashlight on under the sleeping bag, and maybe the light was why I couldn't sleep, but I was too afraid to turn it off. I was afraid of how dark it was outside the sleeping bag.
paras.cn: 我读到那里就停了。我已经读了一个多小时了，但仍然没有睡意。快要凌晨两点了。其他所有人都睡着了。我把手电筒在睡袋里开着，也许是光线让我睡不着，但我太害怕了，不敢关掉它。我害怕睡袋外面有多黑。

vocab.ex: He tossed and turned for hours, but sleep didn't come.
He used a flashlight to see in the dark cave.
The child was afraid to jump into the deep end of the pool.
Many people are afraid of spiders.

gram.name: too... to... 结构
gram.pattern: too + adj/adv + to + infinitive
gram.function: 表示程度太高以至于无法做某事。'I was too afraid to turn it off' 解释了主角为什么没有关掉手电筒。

example.en: The coffee is too hot to drink.
example.cn: 咖啡太烫了，没法喝。

gram.constraints: 该结构本身带有否定含义。

paras.en: When we got back to our section in front of the movie screen, no one had even noticed we'd been gone. Mr. Tushman and Ms. Rubin and Summer and all the rest of the kids were just watching the movie. They had no clue how something bad had almost happened to me and Jack. It's so weird how that can be, how you could have a night that's the worst in your life, but to everybody else it's just an ordinary night. Like, on my calendar at home, I would mark this as being one of the most horrific days of my life. This and the day Daisy died. But for the rest of the world, this was just an ordinary day. Or maybe it was even a good day. Maybe somebody won the lottery today.
paras.cn: 当我们回到电影屏幕前的区域时，甚至没人注意到我们离开过。塔什曼先生、鲁宾女士、萨默和所有其他的孩子都只是在看电影。他们一点也不知道我和杰克差点就发生了多么糟糕的事情。这太奇怪了，怎么会这样，你怎么会经历一个你生命中最糟糕的夜晚，但对其他人来说，这只是一个普通的夜晚。比如，在我家的日历上，我会把今天标记为我生命中最恐怖的日子之一。今天和黛西死的那天。但对世界上的其他人来说，这只是一个普通的日子。或者甚至是个好日子。也许今天有人中了彩票。

vocab.mean: 毫无头绪；一点也不知道
vocab.ex: I have no clue how to solve this math problem.
I heard a weird noise coming from the basement.
It was just an ordinary day, nothing special happened.
The details of the crime were horrific.

gram.name: 体验的二元性
gram.pattern: Contrast between personal trauma and universal normalcy.
gram.function: 通过一系列强烈的对比（'the worst in your life' vs. 'just an ordinary night'; 'one of the most horrific days' vs. 'somebody won the lottery'），作者深刻地探讨了个人主观体验与客观世界之间的巨大鸿沟。这是一种哲学性的反思，揭示了即使在个人经历巨大创伤时，世界依然照常运转的孤独感。

example.en: For him, it was the day his world ended. For everyone else, it was just another Tuesday.
example.cn: 对他来说，那是他的世界终结的一天。对其他人来说，那只是又一个星期二。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比来深化主题和情感的文学技巧。

paras.en: Amos, Miles, and Henry brought me and Jack over to where we'd been sitting before, with Summer and Maya and Reid, and then they went and sat where they had been sitting before, with Ximena and Savanna and their group. In a way, everything was exactly as we had left it before we went looking for the toilets. The sky was the same. The movie was the same. Everyone's faces were the same. Mine was the same. But something was different. Something had changed.
paras.cn: 阿莫斯、迈尔斯和亨利把我和杰克带到我们之前坐的地方，和萨默、玛雅、里德在一起，然后他们走开，坐回他们之前坐的地方，和西梅纳、萨凡纳她们那群人在一起。在某种程度上，一切都和我们去找厕所之前离开时一模一样。天空是相同的。电影是相同的。每个人的脸是相同的。我的脸也是相同的。但有些东西不一样了。有些东西已经改变了。

vocab.ex: In a way, you're right, but you're not seeing the whole picture.
Please do it exactly as I showed you.
My opinion is different from yours.
He was a changed man after his trip around the world.

gram.name: 用于顿悟的排比与对比
gram.pattern: Repetition of '...was the same,' followed by a sharp contrast.
gram.function: 通过一连串的排比句（'The sky was the same. The movie was the same...'）来强调外部环境的未变，作者为最后的转折做了有力的铺垫。随后的两个简短、有力的对比句（'But something was different. Something had changed.'）创造了一个深刻的顿悟时刻，揭示了尽管外部世界依旧，但角色的内心世界和人际关系已经发生了根本性的、不可逆转的变化。

example.en: The house was the same. The street was the same. But after the war, nothing was the same.
example.cn: 房子是相同的。街道是相同的。但战争过后，一切都不再相同了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过结构对比来强调内在变化的强大修辞手法。

paras.en: I could see Amos and Miles and Henry telling their group what had just happened. I knew they were talking about it because they kept looking over at me while they were talking. Even though the movie was still playing, people were whispering about it in the dark. News like that spreads fast.
paras.cn: 我能看到阿莫斯、迈尔斯和亨利正在告诉他们那群人刚才发生的事。我知道他们在谈论这件事，因为他们说话时不停地朝我这边看。尽管电影还在放映，人们仍在黑暗中对此事窃窃私语。那样的消息传得很快。

vocab.ex: He kept looking over at the clock, waiting for the class to end.
The students were whispering about the new teacher.
In a small town, news and gossip spread fast.

gram.name: 格言式陈述
gram.pattern: A short sentence stating a general truth.
gram.function: 在描述了具体的事件（人们在窃窃私语）之后，作者用一句简短、普遍性的陈述 'News like that spreads fast.' 来总结。这种格言式的句子将一个具体的校园事件，提升到了一个更广泛的社会现象层面，增加了叙述的深度。

example.en: He betrayed his friend for money. Greed makes people do terrible things.
example.cn: 他为了钱背叛了他的朋友。贪婪会让人做出可怕的事情。

gram.constraints: 是一种为具体事件赋予普遍意义的有效技巧。

paras.en: It was what everyone was talking about on the bus ride back to the cabins. All the girls, even girls I didn't know very well, were asking me if I was okay. The boys were all talking about getting revenge on the group of seventh-grade jerks, trying to figure out what school they were from.
paras.cn: 在回小木屋的巴士上，这是每个人都在谈论的话题。所有的女孩，甚至是我不太熟的女孩，都在问我是否还好。男孩们则都在讨论要向那群七年级的混蛋复仇，试图搞清楚他们是哪个学校的。

vocab.ex: It's a long bus ride from the city to the mountains.
He swore he would get revenge on the people who had wronged him.
Don't be such a jerk to your little sister.
I can't figure out how to solve this puzzle.

gram.name: 强调句型 (It was what...)
gram.pattern: It was + wh-clause
gram.function: 用于强调某个特定的事物或主题。'It was what everyone was talking about...' 强调了“这件事”是当时唯一的话题，突显了事件在同龄人中的重要性和影响力。

example.en: I didn't hear everything, but it was something about a surprise party.
example.cn: 我没听到全部，但内容是关于一个惊喜派对的。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话和叙事中常见的强调方式。

paras.en: I wasn't planning on telling the teachers about any of what had happened, but they found out anyway. Maybe it was the torn sweatshirt and the bloody elbow. Or maybe it's just that teachers hear everything. When we got back to the camp, Mr. Tushman took me to the first-aid office, and while I was getting my elbow cleaned and bandaged up by the camp nurse, Mr. Tushman and the camp director were in the next room talking with Amos and Jack and Henry and Miles, trying to get a description of the troublemakers. When he asked me about them a little later, I said I couldn't remember their faces at all, which wasn't true. I t's their faces I kept seeing every time I closed my eyes to sleep. The look of total horror on the girl's face when she first saw me. The way the kid with the flashlight, Eddie, looked at me as he talked to me, like he hated me.
paras.cn: 我本不打算告诉老师们任何发生过的事，但他们还是知道了。也许是因为那件撕破的卫衣和流血的手肘。或者也许只是因为老师们什么都能听到。我们回到营地时，塔什曼先生带我去了急救室，当营地护士给我清洗和包扎手肘时，塔什曼先生和营地主任正在隔壁房间和阿莫斯、杰克、亨利、迈尔斯谈话，试图获取那些捣乱者的外貌描述。稍后他问我关于他们的情况时，我说我完全不记得他们的脸了，这不是真的。我每次闭上眼睛睡觉时，不停看到的就是他们的脸。那个女孩第一次看到我时脸上那全然恐惧的表情。那个拿手电筒的孩子埃迪，他跟我说话时看我的眼神，就像他恨我一样。

vocab.ex: I wasn't planning on going out tonight, but I changed my mind.
He came home with a bloody nose after the fight.
The nurse cleaned the cut and then bandaged up his arm.
He was known as a troublemaker in school.
She stared in total horror at the scene of the accident.

gram.name: 强调句型 (It is... that...)
gram.pattern: It is + [emphasized part] + that/who + [rest of sentence]
gram.function: 用于强调句子中的某个特定部分。'It's their faces I kept seeing...' (It is their faces that I kept seeing) 强烈地强调了正是“他们的脸”这个意象在他的脑海中挥之不去，与他对外声称的“不记得”形成鲜明对比，突显了创伤的深刻。

example.en: It was his voice that I remembered most clearly.
example.cn: 我记得最清楚的是他的声音。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常强力的强调句型。

paras.en: Like a lamb to the slaughter. I remember Dad saying that ages ago, but tonight I think I finally got what it meant.
paras.cn: 如同待宰的羔羊。我记得爸爸很久以前说过那句话，但今晚我想我终于明白了它的意思。

vocab.mean: 待宰的羔羊（比喻天真无知地走向危险）
vocab.ex: The inexperienced team walked onto the field like lambs to the slaughter against the champions.
I saw that movie ages ago.
He explained the joke, and I finally got what it meant.

gram.name: 顿悟与主题闭环
gram.pattern: Revisiting a previous phrase with new understanding.
gram.function: 通过重提之前章节中出现的习语 'Like a lamb to the slaughter'，并在经历创伤后赋予其全新的、深刻的个人理解（'tonight I think I finally got what it meant'），作者为叙事创造了一个强大的主题闭环。这个顿悟（epiphany）标志着主角从天真到体验的转变，深刻地总结了他当晚的经历。

example.en: He remembered his father's old warning. Now he finally understood.
example.cn: 他想起了父亲过去的警告。现在他终于明白了。

gram.constraints: 是一种为具体事件赋予深刻意义、并连接不同章节的有效文学技巧。

paras.en: Mom was waiting for me in front of the school along with all the other parents when the bus arrived. Mr. Tushman told me on the bus ride home that they had called my parents to tell them there had been a "situation" the night before but that everyone was fine. He said the camp director and several of the counselors went looking for the hearing aid in the morning while we all went swimming in the lake, but they couldn't find it anywhere. Broarwood would reimburse us the cost of the hearing aids, he said. They felt bad about what happened.
paras.cn: 巴士到达时，妈妈和所有其他家长一样在学校门口等我。塔什曼先生在回家的巴士上告诉我，他们已经给你我的父母打了电话，告诉他们前一天晚上发生了“状况”，但所有人都没事。他说，早上我们都去湖里游泳时，营地主任和几位辅导员去找了助听器，但哪里也没找到。他说，布罗伍德会赔偿我们助听器的费用。他们对发生的事情感到很抱歉。

vocab.ex: She went to the party along with her best friend.

vocab.mean: 情况；状况（此处为委婉语）
vocab.ex: We have a difficult situation at work that needs to be resolved.
The camp counselor taught the children how to build a fire.
The company will reimburse you for your travel expenses.
I still feel bad about what I said to her yesterday.

gram.name: 间接引语（用于传递信息）
gram.pattern: Subject + said/told + (that) + clause
gram.function: 用于转述他人说过的话。整个段落的核心信息都是通过间接引语来传递的（'Mr. Tushman told me that...', 'He said the camp director...', 'Broarwood would reimburse..., he said'）。这是一种常见的、客观地传递二手信息的叙事方式。

example.en: The weather forecast said that it would rain tomorrow.
example.cn: 天气预报说，明天会下雨。

gram.constraints: 转述时需注意人称、时态和地点/时间状语的变化。

paras.en: I wondered if Eddie had taken my hearing aids with him as a kind of souvenir. Something to remember the orc. Mom gave me a tight hug when I got off the bus, but she didn't slam me with questions like I thought she might. Her hug felt good, and I didn't shake it off like some of the other kids were doing with their parents' hugs.
paras.cn: 我想知道埃迪是否把我的助听器当作一种纪念品带走了。某种用来记住那个兽人的东西。我下巴士时，妈妈给了我一个紧紧的拥抱，但她没有像我以为的那样用问题轰炸我。她的拥抱感觉很好，我没有像其他一些孩子对父母的拥抱那样把它甩开。

vocab.ex: I wonder if he'll remember my birthday.
He bought a small statue as a souvenir of his trip to Paris.
In the story, the heroes had to fight an army of orcs.
As soon as he got home, his parents slammed him with questions about his trip.
He tried to shake off the feeling of sadness, but it was difficult.

gram.name: 通过对比行为展现角色发展
gram.pattern: I didn't do X, like [others] were doing Y.
gram.function: 通过将自己的行为（'I didn't shake it off'）与同龄人的典型行为（'like some of the other kids were doing'）进行对比，主角不仅描述了自己的动作，更揭示了自己内心的变化。在经历创伤后，他对母亲的安慰表现出了接纳，而不是像其他同龄人那样为了表现独立而抗拒，显示了他的脆弱和成长。

example.en: He chose to tell the truth, unlike his friends who all lied.
example.cn: 他选择说实话，不像他的朋友们都撒了谎。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过行为对比来揭示人物内心状态的有效技巧。

paras.en: The bus driver started unloading our duffel bags, and I went to find mine while Mom talked to Mr. Tushman and Ms. Rubin, who had walked over to her. As I rolled my bag toward her, a lot of kids who don't usually say anything to me were nodding hello, or patting my back as I walked by them. "Ready?" Mom said when she saw me. She took my duffel bag, and I didn't even try to hold on to it: I was fine with her carrying it.
paras.cn: 巴士司机开始卸下我们的行李袋，我去找我的，而妈妈则和走到她身边的塔什曼先生和鲁宾女士说话。当我拖着我的包走向她时，很多平时不怎么跟我说话的孩子都在点头问好，或者在我经过他们时拍拍我的背。“准备好了吗？” 妈妈看到我时说。她拿过我的行李袋，我甚至没有试着抓住它：让她提着我完全没意见。

vocab.ex: The workers began to unload the boxes from the truck.
He packed his clothes in a large duffel bag for the weekend trip.
She saw her friend across the room and walked over to say hello.

vocab.mean: 拍某人的背（表示友好或鼓励）
vocab.ex: The coach patted the player's back and said, 'Good game!'
Hold on to the railing so you don't fall.
If you want to leave early, that's fine with me.

gram.name: 展现社会地位变化
gram.pattern: Contrasting past behavior with current behavior.
gram.function: 通过描述“平时不跟我说话的孩子”（'kids who don't usually say anything to me'）现在却有了友好的举动（'nodding hello, or patting my back'），作者清晰地展示了主角在同龄人中的社会地位发生了积极的变化。这次事件让他从一个被孤立的对象，变成了一个被认可和同情的英雄。

example.en: People who used to ignore him were now asking for his autograph.
example.cn: 那些过去无视他的人，现在却在向他索要签名。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过他人行为的变化来反映主角地位变化的有效技巧。

paras.en: If she had wanted to carry me on her shoulders, I would have been fine with that, too, to be truthful. As we started to walk away, Mr. Tushman gave me a quick, tight hug but didn't say anything.
paras.cn: 说实话，如果她想把我扛在肩上，我也会完全没意见的。当我们开始走开时，塔什曼先生给了我一个快速而紧实的拥抱，但什么也没说。

vocab.ex: If you want to leave early, that's fine with me.
To be truthful, I didn't really enjoy the movie.
She gave her son a tight hug before he left.

gram.name: 第三条件句（用于表达假设的意愿）
gram.pattern: If + past perfect, ... would have + past participle
gram.function: 用于描述一个与过去事实相反的假设情况。'If she had wanted to carry me..., I would have been fine with that...' 描述了一个未发生的过去情况（妈妈没有提出要扛他），以及主角假设的反应。这个虚拟语气深刻地揭示了他此刻的脆弱和对安慰的渴望，与之前他抗拒妈妈帮助的行为形成鲜明对比。

example.en: If you had asked me, I would have helped you.
example.cn: 如果你当时问我，我就会帮你了。

gram.constraints: 用于对过去情况的虚拟假设。

paras.en: Mom and I didn't talk much the whole walk home, and when we got to the front stoop, I automatically looked in the front bay window, because I forgot for a second that Daisy wasn't going to be there like always, perched on the sofa with her front paws on the windowsill, waiting for us to come home. It made me kind of sad when we walked inside. As soon as we did, Mom dropped my duffel bag and wrapped her arms around me and kissed me on my head and on my face like she was breathing me in.
paras.cn: 回家的整段路上，我和妈妈没怎么说话。当我们走到门廊台阶时，我下意识地看向了前面的凸窗，因为我有那么一瞬间忘了黛西不会像往常一样在那里了，栖在沙发上，前爪搭在窗台上，等着我们回家。我们走进屋里时，这让我有点难过。我们一进去，妈妈就扔下我的行李袋，用双臂环绕着我，亲吻我的头和我的脸，就像要把我吸进去一样。

vocab.ex: The neighbors were sitting on their stoop, chatting in the evening sun.
After years of practice, his hands automatically moved to the correct keys on the piano.
A small bird was perched on the tree branch.
She placed a small pot of flowers on the windowsill.

vocab.mean: （比喻）深情地拥抱某人，仿佛要将其吸入
vocab.ex: After a long trip, she hugged her child so tight it was like she was trying to breathe him in.

gram.name: 过去完成进行时（用于描述过去的习惯）
gram.pattern: had been + VERB-ing
gram.function: 虽然这里没有直接使用，但 'Daisy wasn't going to be there like always' 暗示了一个过去完成进行时的背景：'Daisy had always been waiting for us'。这种对一个被打破的、长期习惯的提及，深刻地传达了失去的空虚和悲伤。

example.en: He missed the old cafe where they had been meeting for years.
example.cn: 他怀念那个他们多年来一直见面的旧咖啡馆。

gram.constraints: 用于强调一个在过去某个时间点之前一直持续的动作或习惯。

paras.en: "It's okay, Mom, I'm fine," I said, smiling. She nodded and took my face in her hands. Her eyes were shiny. "I know you are," she said. "I missed you so much, Auggie." "I missed you, too." I could tell she wanted to say a lot of things but she was stopping herself. "Are you hungry?" she asked. "Starving. Can I have a grilled cheese?" "Of course," she answered, and immediately started to make the sandwich while I took my jacket off and sat down at the kitchen counter.
paras.cn: “没事，妈妈，我很好，” 我微笑着说。她点了点头，用双手捧着我的脸。她的眼睛亮晶晶的。“我知道你没事，” 她说。“我太想你了，奥吉。” “我也想你。” 我看得出她想说很多话，但她在克制自己。“你饿吗？” 她问。“饿死了。我能吃个烤奶酪三明治吗？” “当然，” 她回答，并立刻开始做三明治，而我则脱下夹克，在厨房的台子上坐下。

vocab.word: take someone's face in one's hands
vocab.ex: She gently took the child's face in her hands and wiped away his tears.

vocab.mean: 闪亮的（此处指眼中含泪）
vocab.ex: Her eyes were shiny with unshed tears as she said goodbye.
He wanted to shout in anger, but he managed to stop himself.
I haven't eaten all day; I'm absolutely starving.
A simple grilled cheese sandwich is my favorite comfort food.

gram.name: 未言明的交流
gram.pattern: Observing an action and inferring the hidden emotion or intention.
gram.function: 通过主角的观察 'I could tell she wanted to say a lot of things but she was stopping herself'，作者展现了角色之间深层次的、非语言的交流。妈妈通过克制自己的问题，转而提供食物这种具体的关爱，表达了她对儿子情绪的体谅，而主角也理解了这份体谅。

example.en: He kept checking his watch. I could tell he was anxious to leave.
example.cn: 他不停地看表。我看得出他急着要走。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过行为细节来揭示人物内心状态的写作技巧。

paras.en: "Where's Via?" I asked. "She's coming home with Dad today. Boy, did she miss you, Auggie," Mom said. "Yeah? She would have liked the nature reserve. You know what movie they played? The Sound of Music." "You'll have to tell her that." "So, do you want to hear about the bad part or the good part first?" I asked after a few minutes, leaning my head on my hand. "Whatever you want to talk about," she answered.
paras.cn: “维娅在哪儿？” 我问。“她今天和爸爸一起回家。天哪，她可想你了，奥吉，” 妈妈说。“是吗？她会喜欢那个自然保护区的。你知道他们放了什么电影吗？《音乐之声》。” “你得告诉她那个。” “那么，你想先听坏的部分还是好的部分？” 几分钟后我问，用手托着头。“你想谈什么都行，” 她回答。

vocab.ex: Boy, am I tired today!
We went hiking in the nearby nature reserve to see wildlife.

vocab.word: the bad part or the good part
vocab.ph: /ðə bæd pɑːrt ɔːr ðə ɡʊd pɑːrt/
vocab.mean: 坏的部分还是好的部分
vocab.ex: When telling a story with mixed results, it's common to ask, 'Do you want the good part or the bad part first?'
You can order whatever you want from the menu.

gram.name: 用 'Boy' 引起的强调倒装
gram.pattern: Boy, + did/do/does + Subject + Verb...
gram.function: 在句首使用感叹词 'Boy' 并将助动词提前，是一种非正式但非常强烈的强调方式。'Boy, did she miss you' 极大地强调了“她想念你”这一事实，比简单的 'She missed you a lot' 情感更充沛。

example.en: Boy, did it rain last night!
example.cn: 天哪，昨晚的雨下得真大！

gram.constraints: 是一种口语化的强调句型。

paras.en: "Well, except for last night, I had an awesome time," I said. "I mean, it was just awesome. That's why I'm so bummed. I feel like they ruined the whole trip for me." "No, sweetie, don't let them do that to you. You were there for more than forty-eight hours, and that awful part lasted one hour. Don't let them take that away from you, okay?"
paras.cn: “嗯，除了昨晚，我玩得超棒，” 我说。“我的意思是，简直太棒了。那就是为什么我这么沮丧。我感觉他们毁了我整个旅行。” “不，宝贝，别让他们那样对你。你在那里待了超过四十八小时，而那段糟糕的部分只持续了一小时。别让他们夺走你的那份快乐，好吗？”

vocab.ex: The room was empty except for a single chair in the corner.
We had an awesome time at the concert.
He was really bummed when his team lost the game.
The sudden rain ruined our picnic.

vocab.mean: 夺走你的那份（快乐/成就）
vocab.ex: You won the race fairly. Don't let his sour comments take that away from you.

gram.name: 用于赋能的祈使句
gram.pattern: Don't let [someone] do [something] to you.
gram.function: 妈妈使用 'don't let them do that to you' 和 'Don't let them take that away from you'，不仅仅是在安慰，更是在赋能。她通过祈使句的形式，鼓励主角掌握对自己情绪和记忆的控制权，不要让坏人坏事定义整个经历。这是一种积极的、帮助他人重塑视角的沟通方式。

example.en: Don't let his negative attitude affect your own happiness.
example.cn: 别让他的消极态度影响你自己的快乐。

gram.constraints: 是一种鼓励他人采取主动心态的有力表达。

paras.en: "I know." I nodded. "Did Mr. Tushman tell you about the hearing aids?" "Yes, he called us this morning." "Was Dad mad? Because they're so expensive?" "Oh my gosh, of course not, Auggie. He just wanted to know that you were all right. That's all that matters to us. And that you don't let those . . . thugs . . . ruin your trip."
paras.cn: “我知道。” 我点了点头。“塔什曼先生告诉你助听器的事了吗？” “是的，他今天早上给我们打了电话。” “爸爸生气了吗？因为它们那么贵？” “哦天哪，当然没有，奥吉。他只是想知道你没事。那才是对我们来说唯一要紧的事。还有就是你别让那些……暴徒……毁了你的旅行。”

vocab.ex: That sports car is way too expensive for me to buy.
Oh my gosh, I can't believe you won!
In an emergency, all that matters is that everyone is safe.
A group of thugs attacked the man and stole his wallet.

gram.name: 因选词而犹豫
gram.pattern: A pause indicated by ellipsis (...) before a strong word.
gram.function: 通过在说出 'thugs' 这个词前使用省略号，作者表现了妈妈在寻找一个足够强烈但又不想在孩子面前显得过于激烈的词语时的短暂犹豫。这种停顿使得 'thugs' 这个词最终被说出时更具冲击力，同时也真实地反映了成人在向孩子描述负面事件时的谨慎心态。

example.en: He's not just rude, he's... a monster.
example.cn: 他不止是粗鲁，他简直是……一个怪物。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表现人物思考过程的有效技巧。

paras.en: I kind of laughed at the way she said the word "thugs." "What?" she asked. "Thugs," I teased her. That's kind of an old-fashioned word." "Okay, jerks. Morons. Imbeciles," she said, flipping over the sandwich in the pan. "Cretinos, as my mother would have said. Whatever you want to call them, if I saw them on the street, I would . . ." She shook her head.
paras.cn: 我有点被她念“暴徒”这个词的方式逗笑了。“怎么了？” 她问。“暴徒，” 我逗她。“那是个有点老派的词。” “好吧，混蛋。白痴。笨蛋，” 她说，一边翻着锅里的三明治。“Cretinos，就像我妈妈会说的那样。随便你怎么叫他们，如果我在街上看到他们，我会……” 她摇了摇头。

vocab.ex: His older brothers always tease him about his new haircut.
He prefers writing letters; he's a bit old-fashioned that way.
Don't be such a jerk to your little sister.
He felt like a moron for making such a simple mistake.
Only an imbecile would believe that story.
It's time to flip over the pancakes so they don't burn.

gram.name: 列举同义词以加强语气
gram.pattern: A list of similar, often increasingly strong, words.
gram.function: 当主角觉得 'thugs' 这个词老派时，妈妈通过快速列举一连串更现代、更强烈的侮辱性词语（'jerks. Morons. Imbeciles'），来强调她对那些欺凌者的极度愤怒。这种“词语升级”生动地展现了她的情绪。

example.en: It wasn't just big; it was huge, enormous, gigantic!
example.cn: 它不只是大；它是巨大、庞大、硕大无比！

gram.constraints: 是一种通过词汇选择来表现情感强度的技巧。

paras.en: "They were pretty big, Mom." I smiled. "Seventh graders, I think." She shook her head. "Seventh graders? Mr. Tushman didn't tell us that. Oh my goodness." "Did he tell you how Jack stood up for me?" I said. "And Amos was like, bam, he rammed right into the leader. They both crashed to the ground, like in a real fight! It was pretty awesome. Amos's lip was bleeding and everything."
paras.cn: “他们个子挺大的，妈妈。” 我笑了。“我想是七年级的。” 她摇了摇头。“七年级的？塔什曼先生没告诉我们这个。哦我的天。” “他告诉你们杰克是怎么为我挺身而出的吗？” 我说。“还有阿莫斯，他就像，‘砰’地一下，直接撞向了那个头头。他们俩都摔倒在地，就像在真打架一样！那太棒了。阿莫斯的嘴唇都流血了之类的。”

vocab.ex: It's important to stand up for what you believe in.
He pushed the door, and bam! It flew open.
The car lost control and rammed into a tree.
He tripped and crashed to the ground.
The party had music, snacks, games, and everything.

gram.name: 对暴力事件的 childlike 叙述
gram.pattern: Using simple language, onomatopoeia, and positive adjectives for a serious event.
gram.function: 主角在复述打斗场面时，使用了简单的语言、拟声词（'bam'）和积极的形容词（'pretty awesome'）。这种孩子气的叙述方式与事件本身的暴力性形成了鲜明的对比，突显了他对朋友们保护行为的感激和崇拜，而不是对暴力本身的关注。

example.en: "He hit him so hard, pow! It was cool!" the little boy exclaimed.
example.cn: “他打他打得那么重，‘啪’！太酷了！” 小男孩惊叹道。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过叙事口吻来揭示角色视角和关注点的技巧。

paras.en: "He told us there was a fight, but . . . ," she said, looking at me with her eyebrows raised. "I'm just . . . phew . . . I'm just so grateful you and Amos and Jack are fine. When I think about what could have happened . . . ," she trailed off, flipping the grilled cheese again. "My Montauk hoodie got totally shredded." "Well, that can be replaced," she answered.
paras.cn: “他告诉我们有场打斗，但是……” 她说，扬起眉毛看着我。“我只是……呼……我只是太感激你和阿莫斯、杰克都安然无恙了。当我想到本可能发生什么事……” 她的话渐渐弱了下去，又翻了一下面包。“我的蒙托克连帽衫完全被撕碎了。” “嗯，那个可以替换，” 她回答。

vocab.mean: 扬起眉毛（表示惊讶或怀疑）
vocab.ex: She raised her eyebrows when she heard the surprising news.
Phew, I'm so glad that's over!
I'm so grateful for all your help.
His voice trailed off as he fell asleep.
The documents were put through a machine and came out shredded.
Don't worry about the broken cup; it can be replaced.

gram.name: 对话中的优先级对比
gram.pattern: A character focuses on a material loss while another focuses on well-being.
gram.function: 通过主角对物质损失（'My... hoodie got totally shredded'）的关注，与妈妈对生命安全重要性的强调（'that can be replaced'）的对比，作者巧妙地展现了儿童和成人视角的差异。妈妈的回答将焦点拉回到真正重要的事情上：人没事就好，物质可以再得。

example.en: Child: "My toy broke!" Parent: "But are you okay? That's what's important."
example.cn: 孩子：“我的玩具坏了！” 家长：“但你没事吧？那才是重要的。”

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对话来揭示角色价值观和优先级的技巧。

paras.en: She lifted the grilled cheese onto a plate and put the plate in front of me on the counter. "Milk or white grape juice?" "Chocolate milk, please?" I started devouring the sandwich. "Oh, can you do it that special way you make it, with the froth?" "How did you and Jack end up at the edge of the woods in the first place?" she said, pouring the milk into a tall glass. "Jack had to go to the bathroom," I answered, my mouth full. As I was talking, she spooned in the chocolate powder and started rolling a small whisk between her palms really fast. "But there was a huge line and he didn't want to wait. So we went toward the woods to pee." She looked up at me while she was whisking. I know she was thinking we shouldn't have done that. The chocolate milk in the glass now had a two-inch froth on top. "That looks good, Mom. Thanks."
paras.cn: 她把烤奶酪三明治铲到一个盘子里，把盘子放在我面前的台子上。“牛奶还是白葡萄汁？” “巧克力牛奶，可以吗？” 我开始狼吞虎咽地吃三明治。“哦，你能用你做的那种特别的方式做吗，带泡沫的那种？” “你们和杰克一开始是怎么跑到树林边的？” 她说，一边把牛奶倒进一个高脚杯里。“杰克得去上厕所，” 我满嘴食物地回答。我说话的时候，她用勺子舀入巧克力粉，开始用手掌快速地搓动一个小打蛋器。“但是队伍很长，他不想等。所以我们就朝树林那边去小便了。” 她打发的时候抬起头看着我。我知道她在想我们本不该那么做。杯子里的巧克力牛奶现在顶上有两英寸的泡沫。“看起来不错，妈妈。谢谢。”

vocab.ex: The hungry children devoured the pizza in minutes.
He loves the froth on top of his cappuccino.
I should never have gone there in the first place.
Use a whisk to mix the eggs and milk together.

gram.name: 暗示的评判与转移注意力
gram.pattern: A character's unspoken thought is perceived, and the topic is changed.
gram.function: 主角通过观察妈妈的眼神，准确地推断出她内心的评判（'I know she was thinking we shouldn't have done that'）。为了避免直接的责备或说教，他立刻用一句赞美的话（'That looks good, Mom. Thanks.'）来转移话题，缓和了气氛。这展现了角色之间高度的默契和成熟的情感处理能力。

example.en: I saw the disapproval in his eyes, so I quickly said, 'Anyway, what a lovely day it is!'
example.cn: 我从他的眼神中看到了不赞同，所以我赶紧说：‘不说这个了，今天天气真好！’

gram.constraints: 是一种通过非语言交流和话题转移来处理潜在冲突的社交技巧。

paras.en: "And then what happened?" she said, putting the glass in front of me. I took a long drink of the chocolate milk. "Is it okay if we don't talk about it anymore right now?" "Oh. Okay." "I promise I'll tell you all about it later, when Dad and Via come home. I'll tell you all every detail. I just don't want to have to tell the whole story over and over, you know?" "Absolutely."
paras.cn: “然后发生了什么？” 她说，把杯子放在我面前。我喝了一大口巧克力牛奶。“我们现在可以不谈这个了吗？” “哦。好的。” “我保证我晚点会把所有事都告诉你们，等爸爸和维娅回家的时候。我会告诉你们所有细节。我只是不想一遍又一遍地讲整个故事，你懂吧？” “当然。”

vocab.ex: Is it okay if I leave a little early today?
He practiced the song over and over until it was perfect.
A: "Can you help me?" B: "Absolutely!"

gram.name: 礼貌地设定界限
gram.pattern: Polite question + promise + rational explanation.
gram.function: 主角不想谈论创伤事件，但他没有粗鲁地拒绝。他首先用一个礼貌的问句（'Is it okay if...'）提出请求，接着给出一个承诺（'I promise I'll tell you...'），最后提供一个合理的解释（'I just don't want to... tell the whole story over and over'）。这是一个非常成熟和有效的沟通策略，既表达了自己的需求，又尊重了对方的感受。

example.en: Can we talk about this later? I promise we'll discuss it tonight, I just need some time to think first.
example.cn: 我们能晚点再谈这个吗？我保证我们今晚会讨论，我只是需要先花点时间思考一下。

gram.constraints: 是一种在亲密关系中健康地设定个人界限的方式。

paras.en: I finished my sandwich in two more bites and gulped down the chocolate milk. "Wow, you practically inhaled that sandwich. Do you want another one?" she said. I shook my head and wiped my mouth with the back of my hand. "Mom? Am I always going to have to worry about jerks like that?" I asked. "Like when I grow up, is it always going to be like this?"
paras.cn: 我再吃两口就吃完了三明治，然后一口气喝光了巧克力牛奶。“哇，你简直是把那个三明治吸进去了。想再来一个吗？” 她说。我摇了摇头，用手背擦了擦嘴。“妈妈？我是不是总是要担心像那样的混蛋？” 我问。“比如我长大了，情况也总会是这样吗？”

vocab.ex: He was so thirsty that he gulped down the entire glass of water.

vocab.mean: 吸入（此处比喻吃得极快）
vocab.ex: The kids were so hungry they practically inhaled their dinner.
Please wipe your feet before you come inside.
Don't be such a jerk to your little sister.

gram.name: 存在主义式提问
gram.pattern: Asking a universal question based on a specific event.
gram.function: 主角将一个具体的、个人的创伤事件（被欺凌），提升到了一个更广泛的、关于人类本性和未来的存在主义式问题（'is it always going to be like this?'）。这个问题标志着他从对单一事件的反应，转向了对世界本质的思考，是角色心智成熟的重要一步。

example.en: After witnessing the injustice, she asked, 'Will people always be cruel to each other?'
example.cn: 在目睹了不公之后，她问道：‘人们会永远彼此残忍吗？’

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中深化主题和角色发展的技巧。

paras.en: She didn't answer right away, but took my plate and glass and put them in the sink and rinsed them with water. "There are always going to be jerks in the world, Auggie," she said, looking at me. "But I really believe, and Daddy really believes, that there are more good people on this earth than bad people, and the good people watch out for each other and take care of each other. Just like Jack was there for you. And Amos. And those other kids."
paras.cn: 她没有立刻回答，而是拿起我的盘子和杯子，把它们放进水槽，用水冲洗。“这个世界上永远都会有混蛋的，奥吉，” 她看着我说。“但我真的相信，爸爸也真的相信，这个地球上的好人比坏人多，而且好人们会互相照看，互相照顾。就像杰克为你挺身而出。还有阿莫斯。还有那些其他的孩子。”

vocab.ex: When the fire alarm rang, we left the building right away.
Please rinse the dishes before you put them in the dishwasher.
There is so much beauty on this earth to see.
As the oldest sibling, she always tried to watch out for her little brother.
You need to take care of yourself when you're sick.

gram.name: 用具体例子支撑哲学性回答
gram.pattern: General statement + 'Just like' + specific examples.
gram.function: 为了回答孩子提出的一个深刻的哲学问题，妈妈首先给出了一个平衡的、普遍性的答案（世界上总有好人和坏人），然后立即用 'Just like' 将这个抽象的信念与主角刚刚亲身经历的具体例子（杰克、阿莫斯等人的帮助）联系起来。这种从抽象到具体的论证方式，使得她的安慰和教导既有哲理深度，又极具说服力和可信度。

example.en: Hard work always pays off. Just like how you studied every day and got an A on the test.
example.cn: 努力总会有回报。就像你每天都学习，最终在考试中得了A一样。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常有效的说理和教育方法。

paras.en: "Oh yeah, Miles and Henry," I answered. "They were awesome, too. It's weird because Miles and Henry haven't even really been very nice to me at all during the year." "Sometimes people surprise us," she said, rubbing the top of my head. "I guess." "Want another glass of chocolate milk?" "No, I'm good," I said. "Thanks, Mom. Actually, I'm kind of tired. I didn't sleep too good last night."
paras.cn: “哦是的，迈尔斯和亨利，” 我回答。“他们也很棒。这很奇怪，因为迈尔斯和亨利在这一年里对我其实一直都不怎么好。” “有时候人们会让我们惊讶，” 她说，揉着我的头顶。“我猜是吧。” “想再来杯巧克力牛奶吗？” “不了，我够了，” 我说。“谢谢，妈妈。其实，我有点累了。我昨晚没睡好。”

vocab.ex: We had an awesome time at the concert.
His sudden decision to quit his job surprised everyone.
The cat purred as he gently rubbed its back.
A: "Would you like some more cake?" B: "No, thanks, I'm good."

gram.name: 用于解释的格言式陈述
gram.pattern: A short sentence stating a general truth.
gram.function: 面对主角对Miles和Henry行为转变的困惑，妈妈用一句简洁而富有哲理的话 'Sometimes people surprise us' 来回应。这句格言式的陈述没有去分析具体的动机，而是提供了一个更广泛的、关于人性的普遍观察，以此来解释这个看似矛盾的情况。

example.en: A: "I can't believe he changed his mind again!" B: "Well, people are complicated."
example.cn: A：“我真不敢相信他又改变主意了！” B：“嗯，人都是复杂的。”

gram.constraints: 是一种用普遍真理来解释具体事件的沟通方式。

paras.en: "You should take a nap. Thanks for leaving me Baboo, by the way." "You got my note?" She smiled. "I slept with him both nights." She was about to say something else when her cell phone rang, and she answered. She started beaming as she listened. "Oh my goodness, really? What kind?" she said excitedly. "Yep, he's right here. He was about to take a nap. Want to say hi? Oh, okay, see you in two minutes." She clicked it off. "That was Daddy," she said excitedly. "He and Via are just down the block." "He's not at work?" I said. "He left early because he couldn't wait to see you," she said. "So don't take a nap quite yet."
paras.cn: “你应该去睡个午觉。顺便说一下，谢谢你把巴布留给我。” “你看到我的纸条了？” 她笑了。“两个晚上我都抱着他睡的。” 她正要说点别的，她的手机响了，她接了电话。她听着听着，脸上开始放光。“哦我的天，真的吗？什么品种的？” 她兴奋地说。“是的，他就在这里。他正准备睡午觉。想打个招呼吗？哦，好的，两分钟后见。” 她挂了电话。“是爸爸，” 她兴奋地说。“他和维娅就在街区那头。” “他没在上班吗？” 我说。“他早退了，因为他等不及要见你，” 她说。“所以先别睡午觉。”

vocab.ex: I'm feeling tired; I think I'll take a nap.
Did you get my note? I left it on your desk.
She was beaming with pride at her son's graduation.
The grocery store is just down the block from my house.
He had a doctor's appointment, so he had to leave work early.
He was so excited about his birthday that he couldn't wait to open his presents.

gram.name: 用单边对话营造期待感
gram.pattern: Showing only one side of a phone conversation.
gram.function: 通过只呈现妈妈在电话中的对话内容（'Oh my goodness, really? What kind?'），作者让读者和主角一样，对电话另一头的内容感到好奇，从而有效地营造了悬念和期待感。读者只能通过妈妈的反应来猜测发生了什么好事。

example.en: He listened on the phone, his eyes widening. "You're kidding!" he exclaimed. "When?"
example.cn: 他听着电话，眼睛越睁越大。“你开玩笑吧！” 他惊呼道。“什么时候？”

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中创造悬念和好奇心的常用技巧。

paras.en: Five seconds later Dad and Via came through the door. I ran into Dad's arms, and he picked me up and spun me around and kissed me. He didn't let me go for a full minute, until I said, "Dad, it's okay." And then it was Via's turn, and she kissed me all over like she used to do when I was little. It wasn't until she stopped that I noticed the big white cardboard box they had brought in with them. "What is that?" I said. "Open it," said Dad, smiling, and he and Mom looked at each other like they knew a secret. "Come on, Auggie!" said Via. I opened the box. Inside was the cutest little puppy I've ever seen in my life. It was black and furry, with a pointy little snout and bright black eyes and small ears that flopped down.
paras.cn: 五秒钟后，爸爸和维娅进了门。我跑进爸爸的怀里，他把我抱起来，转了个圈，然后亲了我。他整整一分钟都没放开我，直到我说：“爸爸，没事了。” 然后轮到维娅了，她像我小时候那样亲遍了我全身。直到她停下来，我才注意到他们带进来的那个大白纸箱。“那是什么？” 我说。“打开它，” 爸爸微笑着说，他和妈妈对视了一眼，好像他们知道一个秘密似的。“快点，奥吉！” 维娅说。我打开了箱子。里面是我这辈子见过的最可爱的小狗。它是黑色的，毛茸茸的，有一个尖尖的小鼻子，明亮的黑眼睛，和小小的耷拉着的耳朵。

vocab.ex: He was so happy to see her that he picked her up and spun her around.
We packed all our books into cardboard boxes for the move.
They decided to adopt a small puppy from the shelter.
The little kitten was soft and furry.
The witch wore a pointy black hat.
The dog pushed its wet snout into my hand.
The puppy's long ears flopped down on either side of its head.

gram.name: Not until... (用于强调)
gram.pattern: It wasn't until [time/event] that + clause.
gram.function: 用于强调某个动作或发现只有在特定的时间点之后才发生。'It wasn't until she stopped that I noticed...' 强调了主角的注意力完全集中在与姐姐的情感互动上，直到互动结束才注意到其他事物，突显了那个时刻的重要性。

example.en: It wasn't until I got home that I realized I had lost my wallet.
example.cn: 直到我到家后，我才意识到我丢了钱包。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的强调时间点的句型。

paras.en: We called the puppy Bear because when Mom first saw him, she said he looked just like a little bear cub. I said: "That's what we should call him!" and everyone agreed that that was the perfect name. I took the next day off from school—not because my elbow was hurting me, which it was, but so I could play with Bear all day long. Mom let Via stay home from school, too, so the two of us took turns cuddling with Bear and playing tug-of-war with him. We had kept all of Daisy's old toys, and we brought them out now, to see which ones he'd like best.
paras.cn: 我们叫这只小狗“熊”，因为妈妈第一次看到他时，说他看起来就像一只小熊幼崽。我说：“我们就该这么叫他！” 大家也都同意那是个完美的名字。第二天我向学校请了一天假——不是因为我的手肘疼，虽然确实疼，而是为了能和“熊”玩一整天。妈妈也让维娅待在家里不用上学，所以我们俩轮流抱着“熊”，和他玩拔河游戏。我们一直留着黛西所有的旧玩具，现在我们把它们拿了出来，看看他最喜欢哪些。

vocab.ex: We saw a mother bear with her two adorable bear cubs in the national park.
I'm not feeling well, so I'm going to take the day off from work.
The little girl loves to cuddle with her teddy bear at night.
The siblings take turns washing the dishes.
The dog loved playing tug-of-war with his favorite rope toy.
She brought out an old photo album to show us.

gram.name: not because... but so... (用于揭示真实原因)
gram.pattern: not because [stated reason], but so [true reason].
gram.function: 用于澄清一个行为背后的真实动机。作者首先否定了一个合乎逻辑的、物理上的原因（'not because my elbow was hurting'），然后通过 'but so' 引出了一个更深层次的、情感上的目的（'so I could play with Bear'）。这个结构有效地揭示了角色的优先事项和内心渴望。

example.en: He didn't call just to say hello, but so he could ask for a favor.
example.cn: 他打电话不只是为了问好，而是为了能请求一个帮助。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中揭示角色真实动机的有效技巧。

paras.en: It was fun hanging out with Via all day, just the two of us. It was like old times, like before I started going to school. Back then, I couldn't wait for her to come home from school so she could play with me before starting her homework. Now that we're older, though, and I'm going to school and have friends of my own that I hang out with, we never do that anymore.
paras.cn: 和维娅一整天待在一起很有趣，就我们俩。感觉就像旧时光一样，就像我开始上学以前那样。那时候，我总是迫不及不及待地等她放学回家，这样她就可以在开始做作业前陪我玩。不过，现在我们都长大了，而且我也上学了，有了我自己的朋友一起玩，我们再也不那样做了。

vocab.ex: He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.
It was a quiet evening, just the two of us at home.
Meeting up with my high school friends felt just like old times.
Life was simpler back then, before smartphones existed.
The children couldn't wait for Christmas morning to arrive.
I don't live there anymore.

gram.name: 时间对比 (Back then vs. Now that)
gram.pattern: Back then, [past situation]. Now that [present situation], [present result].
gram.function: 通过使用明确的时间标记 'Back then' 和 'Now that'，作者在过去和现在之间建立了一个清晰的对比。这个结构有效地突出了由于成长和环境变化（上学、有新朋友）而导致的姐弟关系的变化，传达了一种怀旧和对逝去时光的淡淡伤感。

example.en: Back then, we used to write letters to each other. Now that we have email, we communicate instantly.
example.cn: 那时候，我们过去常常互相写信。既然现在有了电子邮件，我们就能即时沟通了。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中展示变化和时间流逝的有效技巧。

paras.en: So it was nice hanging out with her, laughing and playing. I think she liked it, too.
paras.cn: 所以和她待在一起，又笑又玩，感觉很好。我想她也喜欢这样。

vocab.ex: We spent the whole afternoon just hanging out and talking.
The sound of children laughing and playing filled the park.

gram.name: 共享感受的结论性陈述
gram.pattern: A simple statement of one's own feeling, followed by an empathetic assumption about another's.
gram.function: 在描述了共同的活动之后，叙述者首先用一个简单的句子总结了自己的积极感受（'it was nice'），然后立即用 'I think she liked it, too' 将这种感受扩展到姐姐身上。这个简短的、充满同理心的结论，为这个治愈性的时刻画上了一个温暖的句号，暗示了在共同的悲伤和新的喜悦中，姐弟关系得到了修复。

example.en: I had a wonderful time at the party. I hope he did, too.
example.cn: 我在派对上玩得很开心。我希望他也一样。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过表达同理心来深化情感联系的方式。

paras.en: When I went back to school the next day, the first thing I noticed was that there was a big shift in the way things were. A monumental shift. A seismic shift. Maybe even a cosmic shift. Whatever you want to call it, it was a big shift.
paras.cn: 第二天我回到学校时，我注意到的第一件事是，情况发生了很大的转变。一个巨大的转变。一个地震般的转变。甚至可能是一个宇宙级的转变。不管你怎么称呼它，那是一个重大的转变。

vocab.ex: There has been a significant shift in public opinion on the issue.
Completing the project was a monumental achievement for the team.
The invention of the internet caused a seismic shift in how we communicate.
The discovery had implications of cosmic importance.

gram.name: 修辞性升级（渐进法）
gram.pattern: A series of phrases or clauses that increase in intensity.
gram.function: 作者通过一系列不断升级的形容词来修饰 'shift'（'big' -> 'monumental' -> 'seismic' -> 'cosmic'），创造了一种渐强（crescendo）的效果。这种被称为渐进法（Climax）的修辞技巧，极大地强调了这次转变的巨大规模和深刻影响，从普通到巨大，再到撼动根基，最后上升到宇宙层面。

example.en: He lost his job, his house, his family, and finally, his hope.
example.cn: 他失去了工作，失去了房子，失去了家庭，最后，失去了希望。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过层层递进来增强情感和说服力的强大修辞手法。

paras.en: Everyone—not just in our grade but every grade—had heard about what had happened to us with the seventh graders, so suddenly I wasn't known for what I'd always been known for, but for this other thing that had happened. And the story of what happened had gotten bigger and bigger each time it was told. Two days later, the way the story went was that Amos had gotten into a major fistfight with the kid, and Miles and Henry and Jack had thrown some punches at the other guys, too. And the escape across the field became this whole long adventure through a cornfield maze and into the deep dark woods.
paras.cn: 每个人——不仅是我们年级，而是每个年级——都听说了我们和那群七年级学生发生的事，所以突然之间，我不再是因为我一直以来出名的那个原因而出名，而是因为发生的这另一件事。而且，发生的事情在每次讲述中都变得越来越夸张。两天后，故事的版本变成了阿莫斯和那个孩子大打了一架，迈尔斯、亨利和杰克也对其他家伙挥了几拳。而那场穿过田野的逃跑，变成了一场穿越玉米地迷宫、进入漆黑森林的漫长冒险。

vocab.ex: My daughter is in the third grade this year.
The fish I caught was huge, but in his story, it gets bigger and bigger each time he tells it.
According to my little brother, the way the story went was that he fought a dragon.
Two men got into a fistfight outside the bar.
The boxer was known for throwing fast punches.
We got lost for an hour in the cornfield maze.

gram.name: not for... but for... (对比结构)
gram.pattern: not [known] for [reason A], but for [reason B].
gram.function: 用于对比和澄清两个原因，否定前者，肯定后者。'...I wasn't known for what I'd always been known for, but for this other thing...' 清晰地指出了主角在学校的“标签”或身份发生了根本性的转变。

example.en: She is famous not for her wealth, but for her kindness.
example.cn: 她出名不是因为她的财富，而是因为她的善良。

gram.constraints: 是一种强调原因转变的有效结构。

paras.en: Jack's version of the story was probably the best because he's so funny, but in whatever version of the story, and no matter who was telling it, two things always stayed the same: I got picked on because of my face and Jack defended me, and those guys—Amos, Henry, and Miles—protected me. And now that they'd protected me, I was different to them. It was like I was one of them. They all called me "little dude" now—even the jocks. These big dudes I barely even knew before would knuckle-punch me in the hallways now.
paras.cn: 杰克讲的故事版本可能最棒，因为他太搞笑了，但不论是哪个版本的故事，也不论是谁在讲，有两件事总是不变的：我因为我的脸被欺负了，杰克保护了我，还有那些家伙——阿莫斯、亨利和迈尔斯——保护了我。而既然他们保护了我，我对他们来说就不一样了。就好像我成了他们中的一员。他们现在都叫我“小哥们”——即使是那些运动员。这些我以前几乎不认识的大个子们，现在会在走廊里和我碰拳了。

vocab.ex: There are two different versions of the movie.
No matter who wins the election, there will be challenges.
He got picked on at his new school because he was small.
The lawyer's job is to defend her client in court.
In many high school movies, the jock is the main character's rival.
The two friends knuckle-punched as a way of saying hello.

gram.name: 表示归属感的明喻
gram.pattern: It was like + clause
gram.function: 通过一个简单的明喻 'It was like I was one of them'，作者深刻地捕捉到了主角在社会关系上的巨大转变。这个比喻简洁而有力地概括了他从一个局外人到一个被团体接纳的成员的感受。

example.en: When they invited me to their family dinner, it was like I was finally part of the family.
example.cn: 当他们邀请我参加他们的家庭晚餐时，感觉我终于成了这个家的一份子。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过比喻来表达情感和关系变化的有效方式。

paras.en: Another thing to come out of it was that Amos became super popular and Julian, because he missed the whole thing, was really out of the loop. Miles and Henry were hanging out with Amos all the time now, like they switched best friends. I'd like to be able to say that Julian started treating me better, too, but that wouldn't be true. He still gave me dirty looks across the room. He still never talked to me or Jack. But he was the only one who was like that now. And me and Jack, we couldn't care less.
paras.cn: 这件事带来的另一个结果是，阿莫斯变得超级受欢迎，而朱利安，因为他错过了整件事，完全被排斥在圈外了。迈尔斯和亨利现在一直和阿莫斯一起玩，就像他们换了最好的朋友一样。我倒是想说朱利安也开始对我好一点了，但那不是真的。他仍然会在房间另一头给我白眼。他仍然从不和我说或和杰克说话。但现在只有他一个人是那样了。而我和杰克，我们一点也不在乎。

vocab.ex: One good thing to come out of the difficult situation was that we all became closer.
She was the most popular girl in school, and became super popular after winning the contest.
Since I was on vacation, I'm completely out of the loop on what happened at work.
He decided to switch jobs for better pay.
The librarian gave the noisy kids a dirty look.
He said he was going to tell the teacher, but honestly, I couldn't care less.

gram.name: 习语 (couldn't care less)
gram.pattern: Subject + couldn't care less.
gram.function: 这是一个非常强烈的表达“毫不在乎”的习语。通过使用这个短语，作者表明主角和杰克的社会地位和自信心已经提升到了一个新的水平：朱利安的排斥行为对他们来说已经完全失去了影响力。这标志着权力动态的彻底逆转。

example.en: She threatened to tell everyone my secret, but I couldn't care less.
example.cn: 她威胁要告诉所有人我的秘密，但我一点也不在乎。

gram.constraints: 是一种非正式但非常有力的表达方式。

paras.en: The day before the last day of school, Mr. Tushman called me into his office to tell me they had found out the names of the seventh graders from the nature retreat. He read off a bunch of names that didn't mean anything to me, and then he said the last name: "Edward Johnson."
paras.cn: 在学校最后一天的前一天，塔什曼先生叫我到他的办公室，告诉我他们已经查到了自然静修时那群七年级学生的名字。他念了一串对我来说毫无意义的名字，然后他说出了最后一个名字：“爱德华·约翰逊。”

vocab.ex: The school organized a nature retreat for the students in the mountains.
The principal began to read off the names of the award winners.
I have a whole bunch of old magazines to recycle.
He was talking about advanced physics, but his words didn't mean anything to me.

gram.name: 用冒号控制叙事节奏
gram.pattern: Sentence: + [climactic information].
gram.function: 在一段陈述之后使用冒号，可以创造一个戏剧性的停顿，然后引出关键信息。'...he said the last name: "Edward Johnson."' 冒号在这里的作用是增强悬念，突出最后一个名字的重要性。

example.en: There was only one thing left to do: apologize.
example.cn: 只剩下一件事可以做了：道歉。

gram.constraints: 是一种在叙事中用于强调和引出重要内容的标点技巧。

paras.en: I nodded. "You recognize the name?" he said. "They called him Eddie." "Right. Well, they found this in Edward's locker." He handed me what was left of my hearing aid headband. The right piece was completely gone and the left one was mangled. The band that connected the two, the Lobot part, was bent down the middle.
paras.cn: 我点了点头。“你认得这个名字吗？” 他说。“他们叫他埃迪。” “对。嗯，他们在爱德华的储物柜里发现了这个。” 他递给我助听器头带剩下的部分。右边那块完全不见了，左边那块被弄坏了。连接两者的带子，也就是洛博特那部分，从中间弯了。

vocab.ex: I didn't recognize him at first with his new haircut.
He forgot the combination to his school locker.
He ate what was left of the cake from yesterday.
The car was a mangled wreck after the crash.
He tried to straighten the bent fork.

gram.name: 对损坏的客观描述
gram.pattern: A series of simple, factual statements describing damage.
gram.function: 作者没有直接描述主角的情感反应，而是通过一系列冷静、客观的陈述来描述助听器的损坏程度（'completely gone', 'mangled', 'bent down the middle'）。这种客观的描述方式，反而更能凸显事件的残酷性，让读者自己去感受其中的情感冲击。

example.en: The window was shattered. Glass was everywhere. A cold wind blew through the room.
example.cn: 窗户碎了。到处都是玻璃。一阵冷风吹进房间。

gram.constraints: 是一种“展示而非告知”（Show, don't tell）的写作技巧。

paras.en: "His school wants to know if you want to press charges," said Mr. Tushman. I looked at my hearing aid. "No, I don't think so." I shrugged. "I'm being fitted for new ones anyway." "Hmm. Why don't you talk about it with your parents tonight? I'll call your mom tomorrow to talk about it with her, too." "Would they go to jail?" I asked. "No, not jail. But they'd probably go to juvie court. And maybe they'll learn a lesson that way." "Trust me: that Eddie kid is not learning any lessons," I joked.
paras.cn: “他的学校想知道你是否想提出指控，” 塔什曼先生说。我看着我的助听器。“不，我想不用了。” 我耸了耸肩。“反正我也正在配新的。” “嗯。你为什么不今晚和你父母谈谈呢？我明天也会给你妈妈打电话和她谈谈这件事。” “他们会坐牢吗？” 我问。“不，不是坐牢。但他们可能会上少年法庭。也许他们会那样学到教训。” “相信我：那个叫埃迪的小子是学不到任何教训的，” 我开玩笑说。

vocab.ex: The victim decided not to press charges against the thief.
She is being fitted for a new prosthetic leg.
I know it's late, but I'm going to finish this book anyway.
He was sentenced to six months in jail for theft.
Because he was underage, his case was heard in juvie court.
Trust me, you don't want to miss this movie.

gram.name: Why don't you...? (用于提建议)
gram.pattern: Why don't + subject + infinitive?
gram.function: 虽然形式上是问句，但实际上是用来提出一个温和的建议。'Why don't you talk about it with your parents...?' 是校长提出的一个建议，而不是一个真正的质问。

example.en: You look tired. Why don't you take a break?
example.cn: 你看起来很累。为什么不休息一下呢？

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的非正式建议方式。

paras.en: He sat down behind his desk. "Auggie, why don't you sit down a second?" he said. I sat down. All the things on his desk were the same as when I first walked into his office last summer: the same mirrored cube, the same little globe floating in the air. That felt like ages ago. "Hard to believe this year's almost over, huh?" he said, almost like he was reading my mind.
paras.cn: 他在书桌后坐下。“奥吉，你为什么不坐一会儿？” 他说。我坐了下来。他桌上所有的东西都和我去年夏天第一次走进他办公室时一样：同样的镜面立方体，同样的悬浮在空中的小地球仪。那感觉像是很久以前的事了。“很难相信这一年快结束了，是吧？” 他说，几乎像是在读我的心思。

vocab.ex: Could you wait here for a second while I get my coat?
She had a mirrored jewelry box on her dresser.
I saw that movie ages ago.
It's hard to believe that summer is almost over.
You must have read my mind; I was just about to suggest we get ice cream.

gram.name: 用重复进行框架式叙事
gram.pattern: Repeating a specific detail or scene from earlier in the story.
gram.function: 通过重提主角第一次进办公室时看到的具体物品（'the same mirrored cube, the same little globe'），作者创造了一个框架式的结构。这个重复不仅标记了时间的流逝（'That felt like ages ago'），也突显了主角在这一学年中的巨大成长，尽管外部环境未变，但他的内心和处境已截然不同。

example.en: He stood in the same park where they first met, but now he was alone.
example.cn: 他站在他们初次相遇的同一个公园里，但现在他独自一人。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过重复来强调变化的有效文学技巧。

paras.en: "Yeah." "Has it been a good year for you, Auggie? Has it been okay?" "Yeah, it's been good." I nodded. "I know academically it's been a great year for you. You're one of our top students. Congrats on the High Honor Roll." "Thanks. Yeah, that's cool." "But I know it's had its share of ups and downs," he said, raising his eyebrows. "Certainly, that night at the nature reserve was one of the low points." "Yeah." I nodded. "But it was also kind of good, too." "In what way?" "Well, you know, how people stood up for me and stuff?"
paras.cn: “是的。” “这对你来说是好的一年吗，奥吉？还算顺利吗？” “是的，挺好的。” 我点了点头。“我知道在学业上这对你来说是很棒的一年。你是我们最顶尖的学生之一。恭喜你获得优等生荣誉。” “谢谢。是的，那很酷。” “但我知道这一年也有起有落，” 他扬起眉毛说。“当然，在自然静修的那一晚是低谷之一。” “是的。” 我点了点头。“但那也有点好，真的。” “哪方面呢？” “嗯，你知道，人们为我挺身而出那些事？”

vocab.ex: She has always done well academically.
You passed your driving test? Congrats!
Her hard work paid off when she made the High Honor Roll.

vocab.word: have its share of ups and downs
vocab.ph: /hæv ɪts ʃer əv ʌps ænd daʊnz/
vocab.ex: Every long-term relationship has its share of ups and downs.
Losing his job was the low point of his year.
A: "This new phone is much better." B: "In what way?"
It's important to stand up for what you believe in.

gram.name: 平衡的视角
gram.pattern: Acknowledging a negative event but also finding a positive aspect.
gram.function: 主角没有将那晚的经历完全定义为负面的。他首先承认了它是“低谷之一”，然后立即补充说“但那也有点好”。这种从一个创伤性事件中找到积极意义（朋友的支持）的能力，是他情感成熟和心态转变的关键标志。

example.en: Losing my job was terrible, but in a way, it was also good because it forced me to find a new career.
example.cn: 失去工作很糟糕，但从某种意义上说，那也是好事，因为它迫使我找到了新的职业。

gram.constraints: 是一种展现成熟和复杂思维的方式。

paras.en: "That was pretty wonderful," he said, smiling. "Yeah." "I know in school things got a little hairy with Julian at times." I have to admit: he surprised me with that one. "You know about that stuff?" I asked him. "Middle-school directors have a way of knowing about a lot of stuff." "Do you have, like, secret security cameras in the hallways?" I joked. "And microphones everywhere," he laughed. "No, seriously?" He laughed again. "No, not seriously." "Oh!"
paras.cn: “那相当精彩，” 他微笑着说。“是的。” “我知道在学校里，和朱利安的事情有时会有点棘手。” 我得承认：他那句话让我很惊讶。“你知道那些事？” 我问他。“初中部主任总有办法知道很多事。” “你是不是，比如，在走廊里有秘密监控摄像头？” 我开玩笑说。“还有到处都有麦克风，” 他笑了。“不，说真的？” 他又笑了。“不，不是说真的。” “哦！”

vocab.ex: The final part of the climb was a bit hairy, but we made it.
He can be very charming, but at times he's quite rude.

vocab.mean: 总有办法；有一种…的本事
vocab.ex: She has a way of making everyone feel comfortable.
The bank is protected by multiple security cameras.
A: "I'm going to climb that mountain." B: "Seriously?"

gram.name: 玩笑和机智应答
gram.pattern: A quick exchange of jokes and witty replies.
gram.function: 主角开了一个关于“秘密摄像头”的玩笑，而校长则顺着玩笑补充了“麦克风”，然后才澄清。这种轻松、机智的你来我往（banter and repartee），表明他们之间的关系已经超越了单纯的师生关系，建立了一种更平等、更亲近的信任和融洽感。

example.en: A: "Are you a magician?" B: "And a mind reader, too!"
example.cn: A：“你是魔术师吗？” B：“而且还是个读心者呢！”

gram.constraints: 是建立人际关系的重要组成部分。

paras.en: "But I wish you and Jack had come to me about the mean notes that were left in your lockers." "How do you know about that?" I said. "I'm telling you: middle-school directors know all." "It wasn't that big a deal," I answered. "And we wrote notes, too." He smiled. "I don't know if it's public yet," he said, "though it will be soon anyway, but Julian Albans is not coming back to Beecher Prep next year." "What!" I said. I honestly couldn't hide how surprised I was.
paras.cn: “但我希望你和杰克当时能来找我，谈谈你们储物柜里那些刻薄的纸条。” “你怎么知道那件事的？” 我说。“我跟你说：初中部主任无所不知。” “那没多大事，” 我回答。“而且我们也写了纸条。” 他笑了。“我不知道这事是否已经公开了，” 他说，“不过反正很快就会了，但是朱利安·奥尔本斯明年不会回比彻预备学校了。” “什么！” 我说。我真的无法掩饰我有多惊讶。

vocab.ex: Finding mean notes in her locker made her feel sad and alone.
My grandmother seems to be a know-all when it comes to gardening.
It was just a small mistake, not that big a deal.
The company has not yet made a public statement.
He tried to hide his surprise when he saw his old friend.

gram.name: wish + 过去完成时
gram.pattern: wish + Subject + had + past participle
gram.function: 用于表达对过去发生（或未发生）的事情的后悔或遗憾。'I wish you and Jack had come to me...' 表达了校长希望他们在过去采取了不同行动的愿望，这是一种温和的责备和关切。

example.en: I wish I had listened to your advice.
example.cn: 我真希望我当时听了你的建议。

gram.constraints: 用于对过去情况的虚拟。

paras.en: "His parents don't think Beecher Prep is a good fit for him," Mr. Tushman continued, raising his shoulders. "Wow, that's big news," I said. "Yeah, I thought you should know." Then suddenly I noticed that the pumpkin portrait that used to be behind his desk was gone and my drawing, my Self- Portrait as an Animal that I drew for the New Year Art Show, was now framed and hanging behind his desk.
paras.cn: “他父母认为比彻预备学校不适合他，” 塔什曼先生继续说，耸了耸肩。“哇，那可是大新闻，” 我说。“是的，我想你应该知道。” 然后我突然注意到，以前挂在他书桌后面的那幅南瓜肖像画不见了，而我的画，我为新年艺术展画的《作为动物的自画像》，现在被装裱起来挂在了他的书桌后面。

vocab.ex: This job is not a good fit for someone who doesn't like to travel.
The company's merger was big news in the financial world.
The queen sat for a famous artist to paint her portrait.
She has a framed photograph of her family on her desk.

gram.name: 象征性替换
gram.pattern: The replacement of one symbolic object with another.
gram.function: 南瓜肖像画（之前与对主角的嘲笑有关）被主角自己的鸭子自画像所取代，这是一个强有力的象征性行为。它不仅代表了校长对主角的个人认可和珍视，也象征着旧的、负面的身份标签被一个新的、由主角自己定义的身份所取代。

example.en: He replaced the old, faded flag with a bright new one, symbolizing a new beginning.
example.cn: 他用一面崭新的旗帜换下了那面褪色的旧旗，象征着一个新的开始。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过物体来象征抽象观念变化的文学技巧。

paras.en: "Hey, that's mine!" I pointed. Mr. Tushman turned around like he didn't know what I was talking about. "Oh, that's right!" he said, tapping his forehead. "I've been meaning to show this to you for months now." "My self-portrait as a duck." I nodded. "I love this piece, Auggie," he said. "When your art teacher showed it to me, I asked her if I could keep it for my wall. I hope that's okay with you." "Oh, yeah! Sure. What happened to the pumpkin portrait?" "Right behind you." "Oh, yeah. Nice."
paras.cn: “嘿，那是我的！” 我指着说。塔什曼先生转过身，好像不知道我在说什么似的。“哦，对！” 他说，敲了敲自己的额头。“我好几个月前就想拿给你看了。” “我画的鸭子自画像。” 我点了点头。“我爱这幅作品，奥吉，” 他说。“当你的美术老师拿给我看时，我问她我是否可以把它留下来挂在我的墙上。我希望你没意见。” “哦，当然！可以。那幅南瓜肖像画怎么了？” “就在你后面。” “哦，是的。不错。”

vocab.ex: Can you point to the country on the map?
He tapped his forehead and said, 'Oh, now I remember!'
I've been meaning to call you all week, but I've been so busy.
The artist was famous for his expressive self-portraits.
This painting is a beautiful piece of art.

gram.name: 假装无知（用于表现诙谐）
gram.pattern: Acting as if one is unaware of something obvious.
gram.function: 校长 'turned around like he didn't know what I was talking about' 的行为是一种善意的、诙谐的假装。他显然知道画在哪里，但通过这种方式，他将发现的时刻变得更有趣、更像一个惊喜，从而营造了轻松愉快的氛围。

example.en: When the children tried to surprise him, he acted like he had no idea they were hiding.
example.cn: 当孩子们想给他一个惊喜时，他表现得好像完全不知道他们藏起来了似的。

gram.constraints: 是一种在社交互动中创造幽默和亲近感的方式。

paras.en: "I've been meaning to ask you since I hung this up . . . ," he said, looking at it. "Why did you choose to represent yourself as a duck?" "What do you mean?" I answered. "That was the assignment." "Yes, but why a duck?" he said. "Is it safe to assume that it was because of the story of the . . . um, the duckling that turns into a swan?"
paras.cn: “自从我把这个挂起来，我就一直想问你……” 他看着画说。“你为什么选择用鸭子来代表你自己？” “你什么意思？” 我回答。“那就是作业要求啊。” “是的，但为什么是鸭子？” 他说。“我是否可以稳妥地假设，那是因为……嗯，丑小鸭变成天鹅的故事？”

vocab.ex: The dove is often used to represent peace.
The teacher gave the class a difficult writing assignment.

vocab.mean: 我是否可以稳妥地假设
vocab.ex: Given his silence, is it safe to assume he disagrees?
The mother duck led her little ducklings across the pond.
A graceful white swan was swimming on the lake.

gram.name: 对象征意义的误读
gram.pattern: An adult projects a complex symbolic meaning onto a child's simple action.
gram.function: 校长作为一个善意的成年人，试图从主角的作品中解读出深刻的、充满希望的象征意义（丑小鸭变天鹅）。然而，这种复杂的解读与主角简单、直接的动机形成了对比。这个情节突显了成人视角和儿童视角之间的差异，以及有时成人会过度解读孩子的行为。

example.en: The teacher saw the child's drawing of a black sun as a sign of depression, but the child just said he ran out of yellow crayon.
example.cn: 老师把孩子画的黑色太阳看作是抑郁的迹象，但孩子只是说他的黄色蜡笔用完了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过视角差异来创造幽默或深刻含义的技巧。

paras.en: "No," I laughed, shaking my head. "It's because I think I look like a duck." "Oh!" said Mr. Tushman, his eyes opening wide. He started laughing. "Really? Huh. Here I was looking for symbolism and metaphors and, um . . . sometimes a duck is just a duck!" "Yeah, I guess," I said, not quite getting why he thought that was so funny. He laughed to himself for a good thirty seconds.
paras.cn: “不，” 我笑着摇了摇头。“是因为我觉得我长得像一只鸭子。” “哦！” 塔什曼先生说，眼睛睁得大大的。他开始笑了起来。“真的吗？哈。我还在这里寻找象征意义和隐喻，嗯……有时候一只鸭子就只是一只鸭子！” “嗯，我猜是吧，” 我说，不太明白他为什么觉得那那么好笑。他自己笑了足足三十秒。

vocab.ex: The dove is often used in art as a symbolism for peace.
In the poem, 'life is a journey' is a common metaphor.
I listened to his explanation, but I still don't quite get it.
We waited in line for a good hour before the store opened.

gram.name: 格言 (A duck is just a duck)
gram.pattern: Sometimes X is just X.
gram.function: 这句话是对弗洛伊德名言“有时候雪茄只是一根雪茄”的化用。它表达了一种顿悟：并非所有事物都有深层的象征意义，有时事物的表面就是其全部意义。在这里，它幽默地化解了校长过度解读的尴尬，并肯定了主角简单、直接的自我认知。

example.en: He kept analyzing her dream, until she said, 'Sometimes a dream is just a dream.'
example.cn: 他不停地分析她的梦，直到她说：‘有时候一个梦就只是一个梦。’

gram.constraints: 是一种表达“不要过度解读”的哲学观点。

paras.en: "Anyway, Auggie, thanks for chatting with me," he said, finally. "I just want you to know it's truly a pleasure having you here at Beecher Prep, and I'm really looking forward to next year." He reached across the desk and we shook hands. "See you tomorrow at graduation." "See you tomorrow, Mr. Tushman."
paras.cn: “总之，奥吉，谢谢你和我聊天，” 他最后说。“我只是想让你知道，有你在比彻预备学校真的是一件非常愉快的事，我真的很期待明年。” 他伸手越过书桌，我们握了握手。“明天毕业典礼上见。” “明天见，塔什曼先生。”

vocab.ex: We spent the afternoon just chatting over coffee.
I am truly grateful for all your support.
It was a pleasure to meet your family.
I'm looking forward to seeing you this weekend.
He had to reach across the table to get the salt.
Her whole family came to attend her graduation.

gram.name: 对话的正式结尾
gram.pattern: A summary of appreciation and a forward-looking statement.
gram.function: 校长通过一系列正式而真诚的表达方式（'thanks for chatting', 'it's truly a pleasure', 'I'm really looking forward to'）和身体姿态（握手），为这次重要的谈话画上了一个圆满、积极和充满尊重的句号。这标志着他们之间关系的确立，以及对主角在学校未来的肯定。

example.en: Thank you for the interview. We appreciate your time and look forward to hearing from you.
example.cn: 感谢您的面试。我们感谢您的时间，并期待您的回音。

gram.constraints: 是商务或正式会面中常见的结束方式。

paras.en:
This was written on Mr. Browne's chalkboard when we walked into English class for the last time:

MR. BROWNE'S JUNE PRECEPT:

JUST FOLLOW THE DAY AND REACH FOR THE SUN!
(The Polyphonic Spree)

Have a great summer vacation, Class 5B!
It's been a great year and you've been a wonderful group of students.

If you remember, please send me a postcard this summer with YOUR personal precept. It can be something you made up for yourself or something you've read somewhere that means something to you. (If so, don't forget the attribution, please!) I really look forward to getting them.

Tom Browne
563 Sebastian Place
Bronx, NY 10053
paras.cn:
我们最后一次走进英语教室时，布朗先生的黑板上写着这些：

布朗先生的六月信条：

顺其自然，追逐阳光！
（来自The Polyphonic Spree乐队）

祝5B班暑假愉快！
这是很棒的一年，你们也是非常出色的一群学生。

如果你们记得，请今年夏天寄给我一张明信片，上面写着你们自己的个人信条。它可以是你为自己编的，也可以是你在某处读到的、对你来说有意义的东西。（如果是后者，请别忘了注明出处！）我真的很期待收到它们。

汤姆·布朗
塞巴斯蒂安广场563号
纽约州布朗克斯区 10053

vocab.ex: One of his guiding precepts was to always be honest.
She encouraged her students to always reach for their dreams.
We're planning a trip to the beach for our summer vacation.
We had a wonderful time at the party.
This is my personal opinion, and others may disagree.
The child told a made-up story about a talking dragon.
Proper attribution is required when you use someone else's work.
I'm looking forward to seeing you this weekend.

gram.name: 用于指令和祝福的祈使句
gram.pattern: A series of commands, requests, and wishes using the base form of the verb.
gram.function: 整个文本充满了各种功能的祈使句。'JUST FOLLOW THE DAY...' 是鼓舞人心的建议；'Have a great summer...' 是美好的祝愿；'please send me...' 和 'don't forget...' 是礼貌的请求和指令。这种结构是老师在学期末与学生交流的典型方式，既有指导性又充满温情。

example.en: Have a wonderful trip, and don't forget to send a postcard!
example.cn: 祝你旅途愉快，别忘了寄张明信片！

gram.constraints: 是直接传达指令、建议或祝福的有效方式。

gram.name: 括号插入语
gram.pattern: Sentence (...) sentence.
gram.function: 使用括号来插入补充信息、解释或旁注，而不会打断主句的流程。'(The Polyphonic Spree)' 提供了信条的出处，而 '(If so, don't forget the attribution, please!)' 则是一个重要的附加说明和礼貌请求。

example.en: He finally arrived (two hours late) and apologized.
example.cn: 他终于到了（迟到了两小时）并道了歉。

gram.constraints: 插入语在语法上是独立的。

paras.en: The graduation ceremony was held in the Beecher Prep Upper School auditorium. It was only about a fifteen-minute walk from our house to the other campus building, but Dad drove me because I was all dressed up and had on new shiny black shoes that weren't broken in yet and I didn't want my feet to hurt. Students were supposed to arrive at the auditorium an hour before the ceremony started, but we got there even earlier, so we sat in the car and waited. Dad turned on the CD player, and our favorite song come on. We both smiled and started bobbing our heads to the music.
paras.cn: 毕业典礼在比彻预备学校的高中部礼堂举行。从我们家到另一栋校园建筑只有大约十五分钟的步行路程，但爸爸开车送我，因为我穿得整整齐齐，还穿了一双没穿惯的崭新黑亮皮鞋，我不想让脚疼。学生们本应在典礼开始前一小时到达礼堂，但我们到得更早，所以我们坐在车里等着。爸爸打开CD播放器，我们最喜欢的歌响了起来。我们都笑了，开始随着音乐点头。

vocab.ex: Her family flew in from another country to attend her graduation ceremony.
The school's graduation ceremony was held in the auditorium.
Everyone was dressed up for the fancy wedding.
These new hiking boots are stiff; I need to break them in before the long trip.
You were supposed to finish your homework before watching TV.
He was bobbing his head to the beat of the music.

gram.name: 营造温馨场景
gram.pattern: Description of a shared, positive moment.
gram.function: 通过一系列积极、共享的细节（盛装打扮、听最喜欢的歌、一起随着音乐点头），作者在章节开头就建立了一种温暖、亲密的父子氛围。这个场景为后面更深层次的情感交流和秘密的揭示做了铺垫。

example.en: They sat by the fire, drinking hot chocolate and sharing stories.
example.cn: 他们坐在火边，喝着热巧克力，分享着故事。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过具体行为来展示人物关系的写作技巧。

paras.en: Dad sang along with the song: "Andy would bicycle across town in the rain to bring you candy." "Hey, is my tie on straight?" I said. He looked and straightened it a tiny bit as he kept on singing: "And John would buy the gown for you to wear to the prom . . ." "Does my hair look okay?" I said. He smiled and nodded. "Perfect," he said. "You look great, Auggie."
paras.cn: 爸爸跟着歌一起唱：“安迪会冒雨骑车穿过城镇给你带糖果。” “嘿，我的领带系正了吗？” 我说。他看了看，把它扶正了一点点，同时继续唱着：“约翰会为你买下舞会穿的礼服……” “我的发型看起来还行吗？” 我说。他笑了笑，点了点头。“完美，” 他说。“你看起来帅呆了，奥吉。”

vocab.ex: The whole crowd started to sing along with the band's most famous song.
Please hang the picture so it's straight.
He straightened his tie before the interview.
She wore a beautiful blue gown to the ball.
He asked her to be his date to the school prom.

gram.name: 交织的对话与动作
gram.pattern: Dialogue is interspersed with character actions.
gram.function: 作者没有将对话和动作分开描述，而是将它们交织在一起（爸爸一边唱歌一边给儿子整理领带）。这种写法使得场景更加生动和真实，让读者能同时感受到听觉（歌声、对话）和视觉（动作）的细节，展现了父子间自然、亲密的互动。

example.en: "I'm leaving now," she said, putting on her coat.
example.cn: “我现在要走了，” 她说着，穿上了她的外套。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、使叙事更具动态感的写作技巧。

paras.en: "Via put some gel in it this morning," I said, pulling down the sun visor and looking in the little mirror. "It doesn't look too puffy?" "No, it's very, very cool, Auggie. I don't think you've ever had it this short before, have you?" "No, I got it cut yesterday. I think it makes me look more grown-up, don't you?" "Definitely!" He was smiling, looking at me and nodding.
paras.cn: “维娅早上给它抹了些发胶，” 我说，一边拉下遮阳板，看着小镜子。“看起来不会太蓬松吧？” “不，非常非常酷，奥吉。我想你以前从没剪过这么短，是吧？” “是的，我昨天剪的。我觉得这让我看起来更成熟，你不觉得吗？” “当然！” 他微笑着，看着我，点着头。

vocab.ex: He used some gel to style his hair.
She pulled down the sun visor to block the bright sunlight.
Her eyes were puffy from crying.
He's trying to act more grown-up now that he's in high school.
I will definitely be at your party on Saturday.

gram.name: 用于寻求认同的附加疑问句
gram.pattern: Statement, + tag?
gram.function: 通过使用附加疑问句 'have you?' 和 'don't you?'，角色们不仅仅是在陈述事实，更是在邀请对方参与对话并寻求认同。这种方式使得对话更具互动性和亲切感。

example.en: It's a lovely day, isn't it?
example.cn: 今天天气真好，不是吗？

gram.constraints: 通常遵循“前肯后否，前否后肯”的原则。

paras.en: "But I'm the luckiest guy on the Lower East Side, 'cause I got wheels, and you want to go for a ride." "Look at you, Auggie!" he said, smiling from ear to ear. "Look at you, looking so grown-up and spiffy. I can't believe you're graduating from the fifth grade!" "I know, it's pretty awesome, right?" I nodded. "It feels like just yesterday that you started." "Remember I still had that Star Wars braid hanging from the back of my head?" "Oh my gosh, that's right," he said, rubbing his palm over his forehead.
paras.cn: “但我是下东区最幸运的家伙，因为我有车，而你想去兜风。” “看看你，奥吉！” 他说，笑得合不拢嘴。“看看你，看起来那么成熟、那么帅气。我真不敢相信你都要从五年级毕业了！” “我知道，这挺棒的，对吧？” 我点了点头。“感觉就像昨天你才刚开学一样。” “还记得我后脑勺还挂着那根星球大战的小辫子吗？” “哦天哪，没错，” 他说，用手掌揉着额头。

vocab.ex: I can't go out tonight 'cause I have too much homework.
He was grinning from ear to ear after winning the prize.
You look very spiffy in your new suit.
It feels like just yesterday that we were kids playing in the park.
She wore her long hair in a single braid down her back.

gram.name: 祈使句 (Look at you!)
gram.pattern: Look at you!
gram.function: 这是一个感叹性的祈使句，通常用来表达对某人外表、行为或成就的赞赏和惊讶。爸爸重复 'Look at you!'，强烈地表达了他对儿子长大的自豪和喜悦。

example.en: Look at you, all dressed up for the party!
example.cn: 瞧瞧你，为派对穿得这么漂亮！

gram.constraints: 是一种充满情感的、非正式的表达方式。

paras.en: "You hated that braid, didn't you, Dad?" "Hate is too strong a word, but I definitely didn't love it." "You hated it, come on, admit it," I teased. "No, I didn't hate it." He smiled, shaking his head. "But I will admit to hating that astronaut helmet you used to wear, do you remember?" "The one Miranda gave me? Of course I remember! I used to wear that thing all the time." "Good God, I hated that thing," he laughed, almost more to himself.
paras.cn: “你讨厌那根辫子，对吧，爸爸？” “‘讨厌’这个词太重了，但我肯定不爱它。” “你就是讨厌它，拜托，承认吧，” 我逗他。“不，我不讨厌它。” 他笑着摇了摇头。“但我承认我讨厌你以前戴的那个宇航员头盔，你还记得吗？” “米兰达给我的那个？我当然记得！我以前一直戴着那玩意儿。” “天哪，我真讨厌那东西，” 他笑了，几乎更像是在自言自语。

vocab.ex: 'Hate' is too strong a word; I just dislike it.
He finally admitted to breaking the window.
The little boy wore his favorite toy astronaut helmet everywhere.
Good God, what happened to your car?

gram.name: 玩笑式争辩
gram.pattern: A lighthearted back-and-forth of teasing and denial.
gram.function: 通过父子之间关于“讨厌”的玩笑式争辩，作者展现了他们之间轻松、亲密的关系。这种你来我往的对话（banter）不仅有趣，也自然地引出了下一个更重要的情节转折点——关于宇航员头盔的秘密。

example.en: A: "You ate the last cookie!" B: "No, I didn't!" A: "Yes, you did, I saw you!"
example.cn: A：“你吃了最后一块饼干！” B：“我没有！” A：“你就是吃了，我看见了！”

gram.constraints: 是一种展示亲密关系的常见对话模式。

paras.en: "I was so bummed when it got lost," I said. "Oh, it didn't get lost," he answered casually. "I threw it out." "Wait. What?" I said. I honestly didn't think I heard him right. "The day is beautiful, and so are you," he was singing. "Dad!" I said, turning the volume down. "What?" he said. "You threw it out?!"
paras.cn: “它丢了的时候我难过极了，” 我说。“哦，它没丢，” 他随口回答。“我把它扔了。” “等等。什么？” 我说。我真的不觉得我听对了。“今天天气真好，你也一样，” 他唱着。“爸！” 我说，调低了音量。“怎么了？” 他说。“你把它扔了？！”

vocab.ex: He was really bummed when his team lost the game.
He casually mentioned that he was moving to another country.
It's time to throw out these old newspapers.
Could you please turn down the music? It's too loud.

gram.name: 并置（用于戏剧性效果）
gram.pattern: A shocking revelation next to a nonchalant action.
gram.function: 作者将一个对主角来说极具冲击力的坦白（'I threw it out.'）与爸爸漫不经心的行为（'he was singing'）并置。这种巨大的反差——一个人的震惊与另一个人的若无其事——极大地增强了戏剧张力，突显了父子两人对这件事认知上的巨大鸿沟。

example.en: She announced she was leaving him forever, then calmly took a sip of her tea.
example.cn: 她宣布要永远离开他，然后平静地呷了一口茶。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过行为与言语的反差来制造冲突和张力的有效技巧。

paras.en: He finally looked at my face and saw how mad I was. I couldn't believe he was being so matter-of-fact about the whole thing. I mean, to me this was a major revelation, and he was acting like it was no big deal. "Auggie, I couldn't stand seeing that thing cover your face anymore," he said clumsily. "Dad, I loved that helmet! It meant a lot to me! I was bummed beyond belief when it got lost—don't you remember?"
paras.cn: 他终于看了我的脸，看到了我有多生气。我简直不敢相信他对整件事如此淡然。我的意思是，对我来说这是一个重大的揭秘，而他却表现得好像没什么大不了。“奥吉，我再也受不了看到那东西遮住你的脸了，” 他笨拙地说。“爸，我爱那个头盔！它对我意义重大！它丢了的时候我难过得要命——你不记得了吗？”

vocab.ex: He gave a very matter-of-fact account of the accident, without any emotion.
The detective's final revelation shocked everyone in the room.
He clumsily tried to explain his mistake.
The view from the mountaintop was beautiful beyond belief.

gram.name: 破折号（用于澄清）
gram.pattern: Clause — explanation.
gram.function: 用于引出一个补充说明或澄清。'...bummed beyond belief when it got lost—don't you remember?' 破折号后面的问句是对前面强烈情感的补充，试图唤起对方的记忆以证明自己感受的真实性。

example.en: He was very upset—you saw how he reacted, right?
example.cn: 他非常不高兴——你看到他的反应了，对吧？

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中增加层次感的标点用法。

paras.en: "Of course I remember, Auggie," he said softly. "Ohh, Auggie, don't be mad. I'm sorry. I just couldn't stand seeing you wear that thing on your head anymore, you know? I didn't think it was good for you." He was trying to look me in the eye, but I wouldn't look at him. "Come on, Auggie, please try to understand," he continued, putting his hand under my chin and tilting my face toward him. "You were wearing that helmet all the time. And the real, real, real, real truth is: I missed seeing your face, Auggie. I know you don't always love it, but you have to understand . . . I love it. I love this face of yours, Auggie, completely and passionately. And it kind of broke my heart that you were always covering it up."
paras.cn: “我当然记得，奥吉，” 他轻声说。“哦，奥吉，别生气。对不起。我只是再也受不了看你头上戴着那玩意儿了，你知道吗？我认为那对你不好。” 他试图看着我的眼睛，但我就是不看他。“拜托，奥吉，请试着理解，” 他继续说，把手放在我下巴下面，把我的脸转向他。“你一直戴着那个头盔。而真正、真正、真正、真正的原因是：我想念看到你的脸，奥吉。我知道你不总喜欢它，但你必须理解……我爱它。我爱你的这张脸，奥吉，完全地、热情地。而你总是把它遮起来，这有点伤了我的心。”

vocab.ex: I can't stand listening to his constant complaining.
He was so ashamed that he couldn't look me in the eye.
He tilted his head to one side, listening carefully.
I completely forgot about our appointment.
She spoke passionately about the need for social change.
It would break my heart if you left.
He tried to cover up his mistake, but his boss found out.

gram.name: 用于真诚强调的重复
gram.pattern: Repetition of a word for emotional emphasis.
gram.function: 通过重复 'real, real, real, real'，爸爸极大地强调了他接下来要说的原因的真实性和深刻性。与玩笑或夸张不同，这里的重复是为了传达一种压倒性的、真诚的情感，以说服儿子并表达他深沉的爱。

example.en: I am so, so, so sorry for what happened.
example.cn: 我真的、真的、真的为发生的事感到抱歉。

gram.constraints: 是一种在口语中表达强烈真情的常见方式。

paras.en: He was squinting at me like he really wanted me to understand. "Does Mom know?" I said. He opened his eyes wide. "No way. Are you kidding? She would have killed me!" "She tore the place apart looking for that helmet, Dad," I said. "I mean, she spent like a week looking for it in every closet, in the laundry room, everywhere." "I know!" he said, nodding. "That's why she'd kill me!"
paras.cn: 他眯着眼看着我，好像真的很想让我明白。“妈妈知道吗？” 我说。他睁大了眼睛。“不可能。你在开玩笑吗？她会杀了我的！” “她为了找那个头盔把家里翻了个底朝天，爸爸，” 我说。“我的意思是，她花了大概一个星期在每个衣柜里、洗衣房里、所有地方找它。” “我知道！” 他点着头说。“那就是她会杀了我​​的原因！”

vocab.ex: He had to squint to read the small print on the sign.
You want me to jump off that cliff? No way!
My mom would kill me if she knew I broke her favorite vase.
I tore the whole apartment apart looking for my lost keys.
The washing machine and dryer are in the laundry room.

gram.name: 用于恐惧的夸张法
gram.pattern: An exaggerated statement to express fear.
gram.function: 通过使用极度夸张的说法 'She would have killed me!'，爸爸生动地表达了他对妻子如果知道真相后会有的愤怒的恐惧。这是一种幽默的夸张，用于强调后果的严重性。

example.en: If I'm late one more time, my boss is going to have my head.
example.cn: 如果我再迟到一次，我老板会要了我的命。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、非字面意义的情感表达。

paras.en: And then he looked at me, and something about his expression made me start laughing, which made him open his mouth wide like he'd just realized something. "Wait a minute, Auggie," he said, pointing his finger at me. "You have to promise me you will never tell Mommy anything about this."
